Reviews.Title: “Good--ish”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cool. LA style, which means a tad over the top and "ung, cha, ung, cha" if you know what I mean. Feels like a hang out, and probably what was intended. That said, rooms were great. Bed was nice. What I don't like is the non-stated $40 a day parking charge (tip not included) and the price tags on every single thing in the room. Really. The rooms aren't cheap. I don't need to feel like I'm nickel and dimed on top of that. I get it, but for some reason it feels slight. Great location, rooms are nice. Probably still worth it. And, shame, didn't make it up to the pool which i hear is superb.

Reviews.Title: “SLS: Style Lacking Substance”
Reviews.Author: cola_smith
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights on a business trip. If the underlying philosophy of this hotel is to create a hotel room that does not look like a hotel room, then the proprietors have succeeded. Alas, many conventional design features in hotel rooms serve a functional purpose. For example, it is fine to have lights that do not look like lights, but not if they only illuminate a patch or two of the rug, and it is fine to have chairs and sofas that do not look like chairs and sofas, but not if they are so uncomfortable that no human being would want to sit upon them. And an illuminated clock, goodness, how jejune, let's get rid of it, but it sure would have been useful in the middle of the night. And a master light switch near the bed, not very slick, let's not have one, etc... Other annoyances: The lobby was so dark that when I came in from the California sunshine I had to stand for a minute for my eyes to adjust. The lobby/reception staff wasn't that attentive and, when attentive, creepily obsequious. The "fun" little sayings riffing off SLS. (For example, in business center, Surf Lovely Sites.) These were posted everwhere. I dubbed them Stupid Little Sayings and came up with some of my own, including the title to this review: Subpar Lighting Systems, So Laughably Smug, Staff Largely Smarmy, and so on. Fortunately I am an early riser, so the loud conversations taking place outside my door from 430AM-530AM didn't bother me that much. It was not all bad, of course. There was a certain feeling of luxury. The bed was quite comfortable. They had dishes of these tasty mini-apples near the elevator. The pool and gym looked nice, though I didn't have a chance to use them. My last visit I stayed in the Sofitel around the corner and I much prefer it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Georgesoli
Reviews.Content: Had a great time and the service was fantastic. Rooms can do with a bit more lighting, and certainly check the bill twice as errors do occur. very upbeat atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay! No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Worldwidefrrquent
Reviews.Content: The SLS in Beverly Hills is truly a wonderful experience from arrival to departure. I stayed here over the period of 25-27 April, in the Terrace Suite. Upon arrival at the SLS, which is fantastically located I might add, the doorman greeted me warmly, the front-desk staff were very cheerful, and offered their considerations for where to eat, and what to do during my stay. The hotel is beautifully decorated, modern-chic is the look I would describe it as. It was a tad dark, but I guess that's all the rage now, and it truly was designed right down the finest detail! The room was fantastic - really great! Great minibar, superbly stocked, superb beds and linens, and the room amenities were all perfectly placed. The bathroom products are of the Spa, "Ciel" and are delectible, I wish I had purchased some when I was there! The room is very large, with a centrally located bed, quiet and there was a quiet terrace, which unfortunately I could not use as it was raining during my stay. The Spa, "Ciel" was also fantastic! The staff were so attentive, very kind and honest. I had a deep tissue massage which was superlatively relaxing, and used the steam room facilities, all of which were impeccably clean and well appointed. The decor in the Spa was very modern, and definitely to my taste. I also tried out the must-go-to restaurant, "The Bazaar, which was WOW! The gastronomic experience blew my mind, and along with the reasonable prices it was fantastic! You must try the Dry-Ice Caipirinhas, as well as the olives, Philly cheese steak sandwiches! They are really fantastic! What makes this hotel so great is, well everything! The staff are so attentive, I was definitely impressed! The decor is great, the rooms spacious, the spa relaxing, the restaurant hip and delectable. If you are planning on staying in LA, stay at the SLS!

Reviews.Title: “A totally unexpected pleasure”
Reviews.Author: madubo
Reviews.Content: From the time we were welcomed to our room by Danny, to the time we left, we felt most welcome. Danny greeted us by name each time he saw us and treated us as well as he possibly could. The hotel is very unusual and pleasing, pleasant and clean. Rooms are noise-free and large. One of the managers, Scott, was also extremely friendly and chatty at the right time. A great hotel for the discerning guest. The only thing I can fault would be the dark bathroom. Old eyes have a hard time applying makeup:)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: JmaxBod
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and I absolutely love it.This hotel is classy, luxurious, ultra-hip and you never know who you may run into, I don't name names. Unlike other posters who have complained about the lack of platinum recognition, I have had no such experience. As Platinum SPG, I was upgraded an SLS suite and was granted 4pm checkout on my day of departure. I had no issues at all with the staff, they are phenomenal, everyone of them. Big shout out to Neil and Dan out front, these guys rock! My entire group truly enjoyed having the complimentary JetVan to take us around. I have tried other properties in the area but the SLS is certainly my new home when in Beverly Hills. The restaurants are great and I enjoy the pool deck. My only complaint is that SLS seems to be departing from its SPG connection which I feel is a big mistake. Sam Nazarian take note: SPG LOVES SLS ... -Jared

Reviews.Title: “SLS is worthy of your daydreams.”
Reviews.Author: Roben R
Reviews.Content: Having grown up staying in beautiful hotels around the world I feel confident saying that this is one of the best I've ever stayed in. The hotel, restaurants, rooms & rooftop are stunning. Service throughout is fantastic. (I'm looking forward to trying out the new iPhone app) The food is so good it seemed a shame to leave the hotel for dinner. I continue to think about it regularly, especially the apricot yogurt. Two strikes against the SLS: Our suites had very little storage for clothing - no drawers - only a small hanging closet, ended up with our luggage etc on the floor. Daily charge for internet access in the room - I've been to some exquisite places in the world, and conversely to some pretty shady ones and they all offer free WIFI... except the SLS. It's tacky to charge for this basic utility. I will continue to visit this hotel when traveling to LA - I'm hoping business will pick up so I have an excuse to visit more often.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Design but Lukewarm Functionality”
Reviews.Author: sks120n
Reviews.Content: The design elements of this property are awesome especially the lobby and elevators. However... I need a full sized ironing board. I need a bar of soap and a small bottle of shampoo, not gigantic bottles that are refilled and touched by everyone who stays in the room and are an obvious cost cutting move. The mirrors in the bathroom are cool but I need a shower with good water pressure and adequate drainage. The concierge was very helpful and friendly but the front desk should be able to provide a very small but important amenity and not suggest I go to CVS down the street. The pool was small but had a cool design. I would have liked it more if the best sun facing chairs wouldn't have been "reserved" and sitting empty the whole time I was up there. I also would have liked a more conscientious valet service. Please don't make me take out all of my bags and bring them to the side and then wait for you to come over. Also, if I say I'm just running up to the room and will be right back please don't put my car away and make me wait for for it. All in all this hotel has a cool vibe but needs some major sprucing up on service.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: thekittykat
Reviews.Content: Most fabulous hotel!! Stayed for 5 nights in a patio room on the second floor, it was incredible! Great location, close to everything.... Bazaar is 5 star with tapas to die for!! Another great spot is Taste on Melrose, they have a wonderful happy Hour 3-6. They hotel is first class all the way. Only down side is the roof top pool. There are really only about 10 chairs for the whole hotel. The rest are "reserved" for the people renting the cabanas, as we found out going up for some sun on a Sat morning. Get up there right at 9 AM if you want a lounger, otherwise you will be on the ground or back in your room as there will be no where to lounge and use the pool. The internet at $15 a day is a bit much... you can stay at pretty much any hotel these days and at least they have free wi-fi in the lobby. Parking is $36 a day, again a bit of a gouge. Would not rcmnd for anyone with kids, this is defiantly not a kids hotel, way to hip. Other than those minor things, LOVED this hotel, will definatly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTAHOEBLUE_NICE
Reviews.Content: Had a conference in LA and wanted to check this place out as I'd heard it was really cool. I also liked the fact that the hotel was close to the Beverly Center, Rodeo Drive, and Beverly Hills. We arrived around 4pm and found our room to not be ready. The gentleman at the front desk was very apologetic and offered us a $100 hotel credit to use however. We waited in the gorgeous lobby for a bit, walked around to look at the design, and decided to enjoy ourselves with the SPG elite snacks until the room was ready. We received a call that our room was ready about 45 minutes later. I had to get back to my conference by 8pm, so we decided to have dinner at the hotel and use our credit. Our meal by Chef Jose Andres was wonderful. When we got up to our room, we were really excited about how beautiful and nicely layed out it was. We had a great patio. The bathrooms are unbelievable. The beds were extremely comfy. The public spaces throughout the hotel were great. The Starck design was amazing. Loved the photos of people in the elevator. Also, loved the deer heads above fire places. The pool tables on each floor and other cool art (machine gun lamps) are a nice touch. I enjoyed getting in the pool before the crowd arrived the next morning and having some quiet time to read and pray. We had breakfast on the pool terrace and greatly enjoyed the food. Eventually, it was a bit crowded out there as an NBA player was doing a photo shoot in one of the pools. I tried to speak to him as he was standing next to our breakfast table with his entourage. He just ignored me and used some profanity while talking to his crew. He left and I commented about how rude he was. After breakfast, we went back to our room. As I was placing my key into my room, he walked out of his room next to mine with his duffel bag in hand and said, "what's up man?" I assume he was on his way to promote Meta World Peace.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Crusader1427
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days, enjoying the quality of the rooms, hotel location, staff friendliness and good (if very expensive) meals but we experienced difficulties behind the scenes which caused hiccups. Two faxes were sent to us from Australia which failed to arrive. We blamed the fax service for this but later, on boarding our cruise ship, we were told Seabourn had sent a separate message to us at the hotel but it was not delivered to us either so we concluded that backstage administration at SLS Beverly Hills are not as good as a five star hotel should be. Two strikes was too much so I award four stars, not five, this time.

Reviews.Title: “The SLS hotel is truly the best experience one can have at a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Saxel
Reviews.Content: From getting there the feel they give you is just like walking into your own door man building in beverly hills. the service is second to none. the food is truly amazing. the ambiance is truly homey and cozy to say the least. and all the staff are well trained in all areas. the mini bar is well stocked, the amenities in the bathroom is truly amazing. I hope this review is good for everyone to see that this hotel is one of the best in LA

Reviews.Title: “You need to stay here- Sharon fr Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SharonFedeli
Reviews.Content: Let me start by sayig that I read the Trip Advisor reviews - which were neutral, I took the chance and decided to go. The location is fantastic - Great restaurants(more to about this later), Great shopping Staff at this hotel is fantastic! Dumi (sic) is one of the nicest folks there- he is helpful, knowledgeable and super nice. Concierge guys are fantastic too - Thanks for getting us into Bazaar Bazaar restauarant is a gastronomic experience - a must try even if you aren't staying at this hotel. The only negative I have about this hotel is that the rooms need more lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Ciel Spa”
Reviews.Author: Parizia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at SLS many many times and I travel back for one thing, Ciel spa, namely Sabastian who does the best facial you can get in a boutique hotel. He is very thorough and results driven and gives wonderful tips for after care. I highly recommend steaming and relaxing in the spa then getting treated to one of Sabastian's unique facials then heading up to the roof top pool for a Caipirinha. Make sure you call ahead, he's quite popular and not to be missed. The food and cocktails at SLS are also amazing- roof top offers a caprese grilled cheese that is unbelievable. The workout center, pool tables, bar, breakfast, room service, clean lines in the rooms and the wonderful service at Ciel will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda ok - seems to be sliding”
Reviews.Author: RedMustang56
Reviews.Content: Always looked at the SLS as a nice place for a "stay-cation" in Beverly Hills. I have a sense they are not keeping up to snuff. Last stay was just average. Los Angeles has a number of fun, upscale, trendy hotels - and you have to keep up. Even the vibrant restaurant/bar scene from a couple of years ago has begun to feel average. SLS should be thriving on maintaining a cool vibe - they need to work on it.

Reviews.Title: “I was scammed.”
Reviews.Author: jesse_becklee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. On the second night my phone was stolen from my room. I had a very expensive pair of headphones also that were stolen from my room that same night also. I paid over $1,100 a night for the deluxe sweet and I was treated like complete garbage. The roof top bar was very nice till two weeks after i checked out I came to find out that they charged my card a additional $235.00 for a tab that I cashed out on. I called the office and the bar and came to find out that the bartender named Mark let someone else run a tab on my room without my knowledge. I was disgusted with the service of this hotel. Be sure to watch your belongings because the staff have access in to the rooms and will STEAL what ever they can get their hands on.

Reviews.Title: “Completely nonfunctional rooms- only thing is the cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: bice710
Reviews.Content: Friends were staying at a Courtyard by Marriott down the road and I decided to treat myself and go for the SLS. I'd been in the bar/lobby before and loved the sleek style. Front desk and valet staff were ok, but definitely the bell staff gets kudos..they were the nicest and most helpful people in that hotel. But in the end, how cool your hotel looks doesn't matter to me if the rooms aren't comfortable and laid out well. The SLS beds and furniture are too short. Why can't they be normal size? Platform beds might look cool, but they're never, ever as comfortable as regular beds, and this one was no exception. The desk is ridiculous...not sure who would ever use that, and it takes up valuable real estate. They didn't even provide a luggage rack in the room so my suitcase had to be on the ground. Even the Best Western provides luggage stands. When you open the closet it smelled musty and old..or something...I can't describe the smell but it was awful. I never used the closet because of that - also because they have these stupid little leather loops to open the doors with. Hey guys, they've invented these things called HANDLES that work great!! They don't provide any coffee or tea maker in the room (again, even 2-star hotels have that). The bathroom has no space to put your goods. The huge kitchen-size sink takes up almost the whole counter, and you can't put your personal items on the tiny shelves in there. Shower pressure is terrible...a sad little dribble. They put the shampoo, conditioner, body wash in these huge-size bottles which is a little gross because you know someone's grabbed them before you, also the quality of the product was not great. Would have liked a bar of soap. Some housekeeping items: my bed was shortsheeted at the bottom (picture attached) - gross and unsanitary because you know they don't wash mattress pads every time. I did call housekeeping and at least they fixed it the following night. Also the drain was so clogged in the shower it filled with two inches of water almost immediately. That was also fixed by the next day after I called. This place is SO not worth the money. Wished I had stayed at that Courtyard where my friends were. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles W
Reviews.Content: A perfect alternative to branded hotels . Perfect location close to several nice restaurants and large shopping mall. Reception in hotel was very good and fast , rooms are big enough for 4 people ( 2 adults and 2 children ) and very nicely designed as is entire hotel including swimming pool. My compliments to the entire staff in this hotel everybody working in this hotel was always very friendly and was always ready to help. We will promote your hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyNewman
Reviews.Content: First time at the SLS and it wont be the last. Cool, hip, chic hotel with an amazing location. Best part was the service I received from the concierge desk. Particularly Lori. She answered all my questions, set me up on some cool LA things and followed up the next day with a phone call to see how everything went. Was thoroughly impressed by that. Overall enjoyed the experience and plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the SLS Hotel recently. The hotel front desk staff was very cordial and went out of their way to accommodate my last-minute request to see if I could extend our stay another day. The room was very large and nicely furnished. The roof top pool area was very cool and classy and the service was excellent. Overall customer service was one of the best we have ever experienced. We would definitely stay at the SLS again.

Reviews.Title: “Such lovely service!”
Reviews.Author: millie023
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the SLS in Beverly Hills and had the most amazing time. The hotel is 5 star and at a 3 star price so that's excellent for starters. Also, it's in such a convenient location; near the Grove, Rodeo Drive, Real Food Daily (great food there). And, if you don't want to leave the hotel you can relax at the Spa, work out at the gym, sit by the pool on the 6th floor (though the menu there wasn't great), sit in the lobby and people watch, etc. We had a great time and will be sure to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: kansascem
Reviews.Content: Stayed in SLS five days and it was neat hotel. Ultra modern rooms were a treat. Staff helpful in every way. Food great and presented well. To cool to take in the pool on the top but we looked at it and it looked like a fun to place to relax. Rooms are a little dark but lighting was unique in our room. Mirrors everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Two fabulous and memorable staff members”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world on business as I'm sure many of you reading this do and we all have horror stories to tell. BUT - I stayed at the SLS 2 weeks ago and Danielle and Aaron at the front desk could not have been more helpful, polite, professional and more fabulous if they tried!!! And it wasn't just at check in - over my 3 day stay, they remembered my name, said hello every time I passed by and were "consistent in providing great service". Whenever I'm in LA from now on - this is my "GO TO" hotel. Margaret McMahon

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is wow but it also has some....wtf...to go along with it..”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Fairfax
Reviews.Content: So every hotel has its great features and not so great features...I stayed at the hotel for a week, Wed to Wed March 21-28. The hotel does have a certain amount of "hollywood flash" but I think it has more to do with Jose Andres' restuartant The Bazaar next door than the hotel itself. Pros- Has a chic design Friendly front desk staff. (treat people how you want to be treated and they will respect you for that) Was upgraded to larger room. Design in room is very nice The Bazaar, ate there twice...def try the desert bar. pretty cool Valet guys were awesome Cons- Traffic, its a busy hotel so can get a bit chaotic when pulling in Concierge was not very helpful. Room is chic but needs updating. caulk in bathroom is splitting and changing colors. i would say the hotel would of been awesome a few yrs back but things need to be fix/managed...low lighting does not mean guests will not see. I think everyone had a comment on lighting. its ok...could be a bit brighter but i get the idea so not really going to complain about that.... Overall, great hotel, would stay there again....like i said, tip and treat the staff how you want to be treated and you'll have a great time/experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: JCFFB
Reviews.Content: Great service, cool vibe, neat rooms! Can't imagine what there is to complain about. Great stay. Yes....the rooms dark. So? They are also cool, comfortable and very hip. If you want brights lights....holiday inn has big windows. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Stlylish, Sophisticated, and Sumptupous Spa”
Reviews.Author: Abigail S
Reviews.Content: I had the most amazing experience at Ciel spa at SLS last weekend. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating, I never wanted to leave! Their "waiting room" is referred to as the "relaxation lounge" and that, it definitely was. Carol, my massage therapist was so nice and not too chatty (a big pet peeve of mine at a massage appt.). From the minute I got there until check out with Nicole--super sweet and knowledgeable receptionist (i cannot wait to try her product suggestions!!)--I felt relaxed, welcomed, and surrounded by elegance. The white hallways with simple floral arrangements were remarkable and the atmosphere was calming and luxurious. I absolutely cannot wait to go back for more treatments!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Guaditaworldwide
Reviews.Content: Im a very frequent traveler, Im on the road 3 weeks per months. I love cool hotels and always look for the best to stay. This is THE ONE when going to LA. Great room, great food, excellent staff, location and the perfect touch of glamour and cool decoration. Try the Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the SLS”
Reviews.Author: Gardengal4
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews on the SLS. My daughter won a trip to Beverly Hills and accommodations at the SLS. I really wanted it to be extra special. The service was wonderful, check in/out a breeze. I was afraid of feeling a little out of my element being such a fancy hotel, but that was never made to feel that way at all. Our only issue we had was with the bad lighting in the rooms. It was hard to put your make on and get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dusty and Definitely only worth it if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be the subtle and classy Hotel Nikko. It's now morphed into the SLS - who knows that those letters stand for - and the lighting, clubby lobby and dark halls are similar to the Mondrian and the re-imagined Roosevelt Hotel ... two other hotels inhabited by 20-something, agressive scenesters. Yes, everything is overpriced but I found my room to be pretty interesting in its design and furnishings... from a giant wall with a two-way mirror that hides the large, flat screen TV, to highly polished stainless steel sliding doors for the cool bathroom with a huge shower and sink. Trouble is, the bathroom was so dark that I couldn't see to shave so when I went out into the light, I noticed I looked like I was some old man who missed a bunch of spots... Maybe the dark lighting is why the maids obviously missed DUST EVERYWHERE! The worst example was the mini-bar basket that included a $25 SLS baseball cap - it was black and a ton of dust bunnies - not just a little, but a lot! Then I noticed dust all over the night stands and other surfaces. Room service was prompt and good. I special-ordered a smoke-salmon omelette and it was good - as was the homemade pork sausage. The staff was uniformly friendly - a surprise for such a pretentious looking place. From the hotel operator to the front desk and concierge staff and the room service order taker - they were all as cheerful as the Four Seasons people... but the big difference - the Four Seasons would never have such dusty/dark rooms - and they always have 3 or 4 concierges working instead of just one. For my money, I'd choose the Four Seasons any day. But then again, I'm 40-something instead of 20-something. ONE NOTE: even if you are a young hipster, you'll hate a room that looks out on a construction project - that was actually filled with workers and noisey machinery on a Saturday morning. I'd say the only way I'd stay here again is if I got some great deal or work was paying ... but again, there are more comfortable and cleaner options for the same or even less money

Reviews.Title: “fun and different hotel with amazing staff and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mary345
Reviews.Content: The SLS is a different hotel located in the middle of everthing and a short ride from the center of beverly hills, with the price tag to match, but its a fun scene with a great weird design and amazing food-especially at Bazaar which is busy at night. yes it is very very dark as everyone says, especially in the room which was clean and modern but not as functional with the design. the staff is wonderful and attentive and really make you feel special, particularly Aaron at the front desk during check in who was helpful and nice and Danny the bellman who took time to sit with us explaining the local map and help plan what activities to do nearby, including dinner at Bazaar. he and everyone is right- amazing place to eat, even if pricey- its a must do! overall great and different place to stay with a great staff and fun night scene.

Reviews.Title: “You either love it or you hate it”
Reviews.Author: Oliviauk
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the SLS was impressive. The valet parking and the welcoming was first class. Check-in took longer than I would have wanted as I had booked a suite and the front desk manager had to release the room before the staff could allocate one to me. The reception area is dark and quirky. As I went up to the room, the eclectic hotel design was visible at every corner. The room was large but dark. The bed in the middle of the room provided an excellent night’s sleep. Unfortunately the room was behind the pool table and facing the room so was noisier than I would have liked. The bathroom was of a good size but did not have a bath tub. I did not miss it but would expect a room in the $500 category to have one. The darkness in the bathroom is a design fad but not practical. The gym is state of the art. Although it gets busy the equipment is one of the best I have seen in a hotel. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the staff attentive. The breakfast buffet was disappointing. The quality of the food and the staff were great but the choice was far too limited for my taste. Breakfast only starts at 7am so if you have an early start you will only be able to get complimentary coffee. WiFi works well. The hotel charged me $14.95 per day per device. When I complained at check-out the charge was reduced to $14.95 per day. The SLS is not cheap. The amenities and the standard of service is what you would expect in this price category. Overall the stay was enjoyable and the staff excellent but after 3 nights the design and darkness become overpowering and I was pleased to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides great service as everyone says. Always greeted nicely when returning back to the hotel. Especially received great service from Danny (bellman) and Lori (concierge). I also agree with the comments about the lighting in the room, it doesn't get bright but the bathroom is big and the full size soap and shampoo is valued. The only negative is the restaurant we only ate in the restaurant for breakfast one day and even though it is a luxury hotel found the breakfast overpriced and not that good. We preferred to walk a block down to Coffee shop for breakfast after that. Good enough for us. Would recommend to all to stay here for service, room was clean and always well serviced and maintained. Car always ready when called down to be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry B
Reviews.Content: It was my 61st birthday and my husband asked me what I would like. I LOVE a day or two at a fine hotel, enjoying the Spa and having dinner. The SLS was such an incredible experience that this birthday will be one of my very favorites! Ani greeted us at the front desk and could not have been sweeter. We have the American Express Platinum card and it has paid for itself over and over again with the perks. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite. In fact, ask for the room 238 or in that block of rooms so that Ana Lazo is your maid - wonderful, kind lady! When we asked for extra pillows, pot of hot water for my tea, room service and bag pickup - the service was prompt and very considerate. I spent my birthday morning with Claudia giving me an incredible massage, followed by a glass of champagne to celebrate. Dinner was beyond fabulous! A culinary experience we'll never forget at "The Bazaar". IF you love new experiences and like mingling with the cool and hip - this is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and personal service”
Reviews.Author: karen a
Reviews.Content: The SLS Beverly Hills is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at. The location is fantastic, the rooms decadent, and the personnel wonderful. The hotel staff could not have done more to make my stay pleasurable. My review is 100 % positive because that's what my stay was. Do yourself a favor and stay at the SLS Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway, with AMAZING Spa Services ...”
Reviews.Author: Dana S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just wanted a weekend getaway, to relax and be briefly away from our hectic day to day schedule and lives. We booked a room at the hotel (wonderful deep tub where the water flows into the tub from the ceiling!). And enjoyed a cheese plate and champagne via room service and then dinner at Bazaar. Bazaar! Heaven. The next morning, right before we left I booked a facial at Ciel. Sebastian told me right before he started that I would literally see a difference in my skin at end end of the facial. I didn't believe him. He was right. It was a facial that incorporated light and some form of gentle current. I am a skin care and facial junkie and this was the best ever. Pinky swear! Love you, Sebastian! DanaS

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautifully weird decor. Nicely spaced room. Delicious slice of chocolate cake since we were celebrating a birthday. The swimming pool area is gorgeous but I wish that the actual size of the deeper pool was bigger. Staff was professional and attentive. Complimentary wifi and water if you are an SPG member. Great location - a 3 minute walk to Beverly Center and Matsuhisa. Delicious drinks and tapas at The Bazaar by Jose Andres. Cons: The brown leather couch in the room was a stained. Housekeeping need to check on the lighting before we checked in because 2 of the light bulbs went out and we were going crazy trying to find the switch for it. SLS is a dog friendly hotel, and a few rooms across from us had a dog, and the dog was barking nonstop.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Service Without the Stuffy Attitude”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNO
Reviews.Content: I'm the kind of person who does a lot of research before I stay at any hotel. The SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills was the best hotel experience I've ever had. From the moment I pulled up to the front drive I was greeted and immediately directed to reception. The guys driving my car were very professional every time I needed it. In addition because I travel so much sometimes I get a bad feeling with some of the Valets...I didn't get that this time. In particular I believe his name was Lamar but he was most helpful. When my daughter and I arrived at Reception we were greeted by Sean who treated us like we were the only people in the hotel. He told us if we needed anything to let him know personally and gave me his business card. A lot of people say this but with him I was happy to know it was genuine. Whenever I needed something he took care of it for me. I had a small issue with my room and there was Sean again taking care of us. The hotel absolutely screams luxury but you wouldn't compare it to a St Regis or 4 Seasons. It's luxury service without the stuffy atmosphere. I was reminded at registration that I just had to try out the fine food at the Bazaar. I stopped by the concierge station and was greeted by Fredo who promptly made us a reservation. He was sincere, honest and had a great sense of humor even though I could see he was incredibly busy. The Bazaar was just something out of a fairy tail. My daughter and I ate enough to make a large dent in their inventory and my purse lol. The only complaints I have about my incredible experience was that it took about 45 minutes for us to receive our luggage. I understand the hotel is busy but there probably should be more people on staff to handle the business. The last thing I'll say is that I learned all of their rooms are spacious but try and get a suite or even a terrace room. Thanks again SLS for making my short time with my daughter an amazing experience and kudos to Sean the Front Desk Supervisor for making us girls feel special.

Reviews.Title: “first experience at the Sls Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benny b
Reviews.Content: Would love to thank the friendly staff for the warm hospitality, wonderful service for the moment we pulled into the valet. Special thanks to the young lady whom checked us in a the front desk< Thank You Ani Karian

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love SLS”
Reviews.Author: Tcrenshaw
Reviews.Content: I have fallen in love with the SLS. It's chic, it's modern yet the service is old fashioned quality. You'll feel well taken care of by the front desk. Decor is important to me and the decor here is detailed, comfortable and inviting. I might even add surprising. You'll have to just see for yourself. The food in the lobby bar is tasty and beautifully presented. Even the room service was great. We've had a a block of rooms here for our consulting team for several weeks. And despite a few hiccups with room assignments and arrival arrangements, it's been a nice experience. Kudos to the sales team for all of their attention, quick fixes and the little extra touches they've put in place to make us feel welcome. I would recommend SLS to business travelers and vacationers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Raffi B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently and everything was wonderful. Great service all around, particularly Ani at the front desk. She was very helpful and high spirited

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious experience all the way..”
Reviews.Author: KevinKam
Reviews.Content: I stay at the SLS frequently and it offers a variety of ammenities. Walking into the SLS is stepping into luxury at it's finest. The entrance area is captivating, accompanied with the ambiance and soft playing music from Tres restaurant, lets you know you are about to have the best experience the finest treatment. The front desk staff is great. Always friendly, ready and willing to assist you and make your stay as conmfortable as it can be from the very start. Depending on what time you check in, you are most likely to see Lisa Kaiser, Arnnie, Aaron as well as other great staff. I always stay in the premier room with the king size bed, which is comformtable for me. The configuration of the room for me is important, and I have one room that I always request. I have stayed in other rooms, and they are all equally great, I just have a specific layout that I want. Overall, love the room, bed and choice of sheets - comfort is everything and SLS offers that. Dining is excellent, with your choice of either the Bazaar or Tres. I prefer Tres. Friendly and welcoming hostess, bartenders (Gisele and Avery) and waiter/waitress staff there as well. They also take pride in making sure you are taken care, whether you are sitting at the bar area or the dining area, which by the way is exquisite, you have a choice of round tables or couch area by a fireplace. Very well designed and offers a quiet and comfortable mood for your dining pleasure. If you are traveling to LA and need a great hotel to stay in, choose SLS. You won't regret it. In the true SLS spirit, See Life Sideways!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, I mean LA!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eiming
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, amazing pool, top notch restaurants. Whoever is running the place seriously knows what they're doing. We had a seamlessly amazing time from the moment our car pulled in, to when we were waving goodbye when we left. Sorry, I'm not a big LA fan (yet) but my experience at the SLS just may turn me into one!!! I look forward to going back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Louise L
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 6 am in the morning after catching an over night flight from Honolulu we where not sure if our room would be ready. I had even prepared a plea for a room so we could catch a few hours of sleep, but to our surprise we were greeted with 5 star service from the get-go. Within 10 min from arriving and given our car keys to the valet guy, we where in our room and our bags arrived within minutes. The design of this hotel is really something else and the rooms have all the right touches and features. The location is great and only a 2 min walk from the Beverly Center. The roof top pool is just something else with the art and mirrors surrounding it. We were only here for 1 night and had already made reservations at Katsuya in Hollywood so we only had a drink at Bazaar but boy they where some good drinks. Next time I'm in LA I'm definitely staying at the SLS again and I can highly recommend if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awake at 6:19 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: travelPAJ
Reviews.Content: I was awoken this morning shortly after 6 a.m. by a fire alarm. Clearly the alarm is intended to wake you up, so it is not gentle, it literally jolts you out of bed. Being on the top floor I was apprehensive, is it real? Is it a false alarm? I tried phoning downstairs to no avail. Got dressed and ran out only to be told in the hall to go back to bed, false alarm. Now these things happen, they are after all for everyone's safety, however when I called the lobby to ask what the cause was, I was told it was unknown. I asked if this has happened recently but the answer was "we are not allowed to disclose." Understood, so I asked to speak to the manager. Hold, hold, hold. Gave up. Called again a few minutes later as at this point the headache prevented me from sleeping. I was told manager would be right with me which really meant hold so long that I again thought of hanging up; this time i didn't. I expressed my concern for safety and asked what had really occured only to be vaguely told it was a 'false alarm,' I asked when was the last time this happened and the manager replied he did not know. When I pressed, I was then told 'well I have only been here a short while so that is why I don't know." I asked the manager who would know, he replied the operations manager; I asked him to please find out and get back to me as he seemed rather uncooperative regarding what I considered to be a safety concern, he replied he would. He never did. No one did. I called the fire department to ask about safety issues at the hotel. First thing I learned was that this hotel, in spite of the name and all its marketing, is not in Beverly Hills but in Los Angeles, so I was redirected to the Los Angeles fire department. The local inspector told me that in fact there had been 'quite a few incidents' in this hotel but they were mostly attributed to incorrectly placed sensors in the kitchen, the inspector was under the impression the hotel had resolved this but he would follow up. Since management never gave me a response i asked a member of the cleaning crew, he told me that this happens often and always at the worst time, he said, 'it recently happened at 3 a.m." I am shocked that management completely ignored my request for info and never replied. It is clear that the "I don't know answer" really means "I don't want to answer" as in the truth is not pretty. I will be cutting my stay short here. While most fault this hotel on lighting, which really is terrible, or staff attitude, which has room for serious improvement; or the gym, which is tired and dated and has no shower, steam or locker facilities unless you pay to use the spa, my main concern is one of safety and given the lack of reply I caution others.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be...”
Reviews.Author: Tri H
Reviews.Content: Had a friday night available and took the wife for a quick staycation at SLS. What a great time. Situated in the perfect part of LA, with everything nearby. The hotel was awesome, the staff were friendly, and environment was perfect. Too bad we missed the beautiful pool (bad weather). I definitely recommend staying there if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Be wowed”
Reviews.Author: CCbostonma
Reviews.Content: From the dark entryway, to the usually friendly check in staff - this is like a luxury W feel I've stayed here a bunch - as a Platinum starwood member. So the rooms have varied from a massive two room suite, to some that have an outdoor balcony area to enjoy some LA warmth. One consistent style approach I don't get is that the desk is behind the bed and usually the space between the wall and chair is tight making it feel like a cramped work area. The shower is walk in huge - though you'll get a shot of cold water as you need to reach under the shower to turn on the water. And of course - the Bazaar. Just count on being seated 30 minutes after your reservation time and enjoy the dazzle of Andres. Or go to Saam if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: profiteroles21
Reviews.Content: I made several quick calls to SLS Hotel FRONT DESK Friday morning, and was fortunate enough to have my calls taken by LISA. If I were basing my decision to stay @this property on telephone interaction, I would have done so because of her...she is front desk professionalism personified...she answered my questions, made suggestions, & informed me of upgrade options. She is everything a guest would expect to find at a top hotel, but sadly rarely does ...Also sending kudos to Narita(?) who was the hotel operator...very pleasant as well, & spoke in a clear & precise manner. Well done SLS!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City -- Greatest City in the World
Reviews.Title: “Creative design; cool rooms; hip crowd; a bit far from Bev Hills”
Reviews.Author: talent_guy
Reviews.Content: If you like design, this is a very interesting hotel. Starck's design flair makes the rooms and the public areas entertaining yet still comfortable. The Andres designed menus are creative with non-weird twists on Med cooking. Rooms are different and if you like 150-watt bulbs this is not the right hotel for you. Lots of smoked mirrors and dim lighting even in the bathroom gives rooms a nightclub feel. They do have fun twists like an all in one gym in my last room. It can be loud with some very large parties held there. The crowd is definitely upscale with partying first on many lists. As I left one morning at 4am a Maybach pulled up and two beautiful couples staggered out, their night just ending. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: jcjd2000
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of Beverly Hills, amazing beds, and really accommodating staff. If you can find a good rate online, you won't go wrong with the SLS... as long as you don't mind a bit of quirkiness and clubby-vibe during your hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quite the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgropp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Feb 19-20 after our cruise. We used th SPG option, using 4800 points and $90.00. It was money well spent. The hotel is ultra modern and the service was amazing. The outdoor lobby was so quaint and the upstairs pool area with the private cabannas was great. The location was ideal. Definetly will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not just another pretty face”
Reviews.Author: ShiraP
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous property with service to match! I enjoyed a birthday visit to SLS last week and I was bowled over by the stunning decor, luxurious touches, and sincere professionalism of the staff. Definitely splurge-worthy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wes G
Reviews.Content: 5 star service, pool, restaurants,.... Everything! Treated like you should at a 5 star. Close to sunset, stayed there for the music fest. Would recommend to anyone who has the $ to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Whimsy over Function”
Reviews.Author: patrickstpaul
Reviews.Content: I want to love this hotel – it’s located in Beverly Hills, there’s great attention to design, there are beautiful people walking around and the staff is gracious and friendly. But I do not love it because although the design is theatrical and memorable, its whimsy takes precedence over functionality. I’m a platinum SPG and was upgraded to a 2nd floor room with a balcony (I believe balconies are only available on the second floor rooms) and my room was comfortable and interesting. The lighting in the room is fabulous for ambiance with so many lights to choose from and all with dimmer functionality (although never bright), but try getting ready and evaluating how you look in smoked glass and low light. The furniture is awesome and I loved the bed positioned in the middle of the room with the desk behind it, but how do you plug in your iPad or phone so that you can use it bed? I had to drape the cord over the back of the bed into the side of the desk and then it was too short to keep my iPad charged in bed. The desk chair is comfortable if you don’t have ambition to move around or lean back – it doesn’t move without picking it up and carrying the chair to its new position. The closet doors are attractive, but the closet lacks a luggage rack to set your suitcase on within the closet and be aware when you open the liquor cabinet next to the closet – the hinged door will slam down on you without warning. The ironing board has a lovely birdcage image on its cover, however try ironing a shirt on it – it’s the dorm-sized version you never used in college and works even worse in this room because the only place to set it on is the desk and then the board slides all over. Would it have been too much to provide a standard ironing board? With all of this complaining you’d think I have issues with the bathroom as others have pointed out. I don’t. I actually liked the stone and mirrors in the bathroom and thought the shower was very nice. I especially appreciated all of the shelves near the sink to set toiletries. As for the pool, I like when designers take risks, but the Alice in Wonderland meets urban garage sale didn’t so much as create an oasis as it made me feel like I was intruding on an outdoor mirror and frame sale. I still don’t know what the purpose was for the pool with 6” of water that monopolized half the deck space. I found the pool service to be exceptional (I believe her name was Stephani) but the food was bland and the pool area overall is quite congested and unattractive. The gym was great, but the ceiling is pretty low in the weight machine area and like the rest of the property felt a little cavernous. I’m not, not recommending this hotel – really the entire staff was wonderful from Valet to Concierge to front desk to pool and I really did enjoy the frivolity of the aesthetics. I even liked lounging in the room and sitting out on my patio. I just don’t think I’d choose it again when there are other options in Beverly Hills/Century City/WeHo that could provide a little more functionality in the room and comfort at the pool with or without the whimsy.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant AND comfortable”
Reviews.Author: melinda311
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! i didn't actually stay in the hotel (but the rooms are fantastic and I will absolutely put visiting clients into this hotel). A number of my colleagues and I now use this as a place to meet convivially with colleagues or out of town friends and business associates. The staff could not possibly have been nicer. There are numerous areas to meet - one with cozy couches and fireplaces, another in a high tech section, another with private cushy comfortable chairs and couches - and everywhere electric outlets to plug in ones computers. There are both wonderful tasty snacks and divine food. And the food service director is this amazing woman, French i believe, who could even talk to us about wines and history and Europe. A delight! It's in Beverly Hills yet a few blocks away from the mad traffic. A veritable friendly elegant oasis in the midst of a busy city. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Happening Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RemyBoy
Reviews.Content: SLS...a very hip happening hotel. The restaurant is Jose Andres The Bazaar, very hip place. Our hotel room was very comfortable. Good location in the Miracle Mile area, near Beverly Center (nice shopping mall), 3rd Street (boutique shopping and good restaurants) and lots of restaurants on La Cienega. The Cons...Far from LAX. They do charge for internet unless you are a platinum SPG member. They also charged $35 a day to park your car which you have not choice since street parking is by permit. My husband did complain about the bath towels, he thought they were flimsy.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked It!”
Reviews.Author: islascaribe
Reviews.Content: I did read many of the reviews, so I was prepared for dim lighting and dust, etc. but really, all in all, the SLS rooms (we had 2) were spotless and the lighting was fine. Maybe the lighting had been changed recently as the manager's response in prior reviews indicated, I don't know. We opened the curtains and the lighting was fine for our purposes (computer, reading, etc.). The standout here is the staff! Seriously, we have never had such lovely and wonderful staff at any hotel anywhere. We were only there for 2 days, but each time we came in, we were greeted as if we were friends and warmly welcomed back by more than one staff person. I would like to mention several staff members that went above and beyond...from Tres Restaurant, there was Mallory, Lacey, Lauren and Rachel. I did partake of the great free coffee in the mornings and was pleasantly surprised to learn that I could take box of the buffet breakfast up to our room, which was super convenient. The staff was happy to get the box and pack up some awesome Greek yogurt for my kids (yes, I had kids there...they loved it). At the front desk, Aaron was just so sweet and friendly and helpful and Bobby the bellman was super at showing us around for our first time in the hotel. The best example of employee awesomeness had to be Gerald...who, when I asked for a trash bin for our almost finished Frappuccinos, smiled and warmly took them from me, gross napkins and all, took them from me. He could not have been nicer about it and I was not expecting THAT kind of service. The apples in the lobby were also a great touch and we loved them! The only problem that we had was an issue with the AC in RM 323. I did report it and they did work on it several times, but it was not a huge deal, since we simply opened the window to get cool air. I loved the full size shampoos and lotions...that's a great touch. We will be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weekend stay not a day longer!”
Reviews.Author: Taloli
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the fun decor and ambiance, you start noticing the inadequacies in over all services and your basic amenities. 1- room lighting terrible. Super dark, suitable for weekend stay and not a day longer.. The darkeness in the rooms and especially in the bathrooms starts to weigh on you. Especially for ladies,it's super hard to apply make up. Had to requests for 2 extra floor lamps. 2- Rooms & bathrooms were dusty. I understand since decor incorporates Alot of mirror surfaces, so it easily shows dust, however cleaning staff need to be more thorough. On one occasion a housekeeping staff member left a dirty cleaning rag on the sink. And another time we found the shower tile that had the drain hole under over turned and left there! 3-lack of coffee machine or counter area to prepare coffee or tea when house keeping provided a water kettle. 4-when I asked room service to clear mini bar for me ( as I don't drink and I need the space for my medication they wanted to charge me 25$!!) I have asked 5star hotel all over the world to clear my mini bar and never was I charged for it! 5-finally worse of all was the check out process. The staff were confused and unorganized and this led to our card being charged twice for the amenities of our stay! We had already paid in full for our 9 day stay prior to checking in, so we expected checking out to be streamlined and simple. That wasn't the case, my husband had to speak To the billing department to solve issue and have our card reimbursed.

Reviews.Title: “Spent two weeks there and yes the best place in LA”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: In my last review i refered to the hotel as a W for adults and while true it is so much more. The best food and i have to say some of the best staff i have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Glum and Glummer”
Reviews.Author: RaiMondo27
Reviews.Content: The property's fine location, stellar restaurant fare, and cheerful employees are at variance with the hotel's dreary sleep quarters. How bitterly they disappoint, with dismal corridors and morgue-like rooms. It would seem to be a hotel prepared for a celebrity death, but honestly, what celebrity would be caught dead staying there? Starwood guests may be dismayed to find that this Starck exercise in rich materials and poor functionality has somehow gotten itself onto the Luxury Collection list. If none of this dissuades you, or if you've had such a fine night at The Bazaar that you decide to stay over, remember to be nice to the hotel employees. They work in a soulless building, yet still manage to serve guests with warmth and humanity. It can't be easy.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, fun hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: A unique SPG property. This was my 2nd stay. The differences and outlandish touches are what makes this place fun. Great people watching. Not a place for families or business travel. A great hotel for a weekend getaway. I love the room decor (not my personal style but that's part of the appeal) and especially the well-appointed bath. The mirrors everywhere are what make the place. If this is not your thing, go to a Westin. Really good valet service; certainly helps justify the price. I have to give hotel "average" for service overall due to poor staffing and lack of attentiveness at pool deck on weekend as well as lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms. Great art. Somewhat challenged walking location.”
Reviews.Author: sidripley
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to find things to make fun of...over the top, over priced silly things, etc but it was a great experience at the SLS. Completely friendly staff without attitude. The "app" didn't seem to want to take my room number so could not "check into The Abbey" as a guest at the hotel but the rooms were large, the pool lovely, the outdoor waiting lobby was great in the rain. Coffee in lobby and newspaper on your door was nice. No problem at all with the lighting...maybe it's all been fixed or maybe it's not as bad as some people suggested. I know I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “the gym (so-so), room amenities (misleading) and staff training (superb)”
Reviews.Author: superdeluxe
Reviews.Content: I am sticking to the gym, the room amenities and staff training for my review, to not repeat others' raves. Overall a very good hotel, loved the location in particular. The gym: is fairly large and has some unusual features such as leather sofas and some equipment that no one seems to use - several of the cross-trainers and treadmills were out of order when I was there so there was a line of people waiting to do their morning cardio each day - this is one aspect they should improve. It is LA and we had a lot of tacos to burn off. The room amenities: as others have mentioned, the full sized bath gels etc. are cool and then there are all these small items that appear to be offered for your use but they are not. There was definitely no indication that they were for sale until our last day when a price list appeared. I cringed! Oops, too late. I had used the $46 moisturizer and did wonder why it had not been replenished. I think it happens a lot that the price list is not evident, so beware. My best impression, really, was not the dazzle of the Philippe Starckness of the rooms or the molecularness of the gastronomy but how well run the hotel is and how polished and well trained the staff is. This is a rare thing to be impressed by: the staff was in every respect incredibly well-spoken, courteous and warm (and not phony), every request was handled promptly (they do not provide robes and slippers in the rooms but you get them in about 60 seconds when you ask), and they were very well aware of who was in the hotel and where they were at all times, which means you can expect discretion and security and we like that.

Reviews.Title: “Not what they think they are!”
Reviews.Author: mdsd2012
Reviews.Content: We recently attended an event and stayed overnight. While the staff was competent, friendly and helpful, the hotel seems 'tired" the carpeted entry needs to be replaced, the "dark tone walls and carpet are soiled and mismatched where they tried to patch it. The guest rooms were VERY DARK, and not user-friendly. Light switches are well hidden, some lamps were not even plugged in, the plumbing leaked to the point of having us put towels down. When reported, the front desk response was "oh yeah-- that happens all the time". VIP/Celebrities at our event commented that they would never stay there-- just attend an event. The dining service is very slow, yet the meal was quite good. Too bad. The banquet area and staff was top notch. Lesson learned from the pros-- "attend and event, but don't stay there".

Reviews.Title: “Pear Recovery Retreat at SLS”
Reviews.Author: PlasticDan
Reviews.Content: Was referred to Recover after surgery at Pearl Recovery Retreat at luxurious and trendy SLS hotel. Was booked at their suite after discussed my stay with Isabella, owner of that recovery. It was my first time in LA and that location did give me chance to be right in the center if the city, close to all shopping and entertainment . Service of both SLS and Pearl Recovery Retreay were excellent . Will be back soon!!! Danielle

Reviews.Title: “Depressingly dark”
Reviews.Author: Rom H
Reviews.Content: The hotel try to be too hip and too modern (and I like modern/minimalist) to a level that it is not functional or comfortable. Everything is too dark, the lobby, the hallways, the rooms, the restrooms. No light in the closet or the bathroom, no space to hang the towel, poor amenities (no bar soap, no tooth brush or mouth wash etc...). Restaurant seats as well as conference seats are uncomfortable. The services though was good and the Bizzar restaurant has an original menu. Overall W is a much nicer product and both are Starwood brands.

Reviews.Title: “Plush budoir!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ing33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SLS in Nov with my sister and really enjoyed it. Hotels can sometimes come down to personal taste and preference and this was definitely ours. You can tell when you walk in the decor is very cool and sumptuous and the bedrooms continued the theme. Cushions, curtains, decor, all very comfortable and plush. The concierge told us about the perks - car service, clothes pressing etc, but it was part of a conversation and slight afterthought, I think I would make these a bit more upfront. The TV is amazing, appeared on a big mirrored wall - a bit OTT but that's what I like about it. The only slightly downside is that while the bathroom looks gorgeous with a bath the shape of an egg, it's a little tricky to climb into - not a big deal though. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for us!”
Reviews.Author: australiantripper_10
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at the very glam SLS in December; my husband and I and our 10 and 13 year old. Staff were all great and very helpful but this is place is for the 20-30 jet set crowd! Rooms are very small, very dark and cluttered with way too cool and too many objects de art. Bathrooms have no ventilation and the shower curtain over the waist deep bath tub was totally ineffective. In fact, so much so that the ceiling in the bathroom was starting to come away - not a good look for a top rated hotel. Good location next to Beverly Centre but there really isn't a central location in LA and invariably, you get a car or use car services anyway? The attached restaurant, Bazaar was brilliant though. Sorry but we won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners only hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malaryan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and luxurious. From a personal point of view, i would highly recommend the hotel for clubs and honeymooners (the hotel is very calm, cozy, and kinda romantic).

Reviews.Title: “Too dark!”
Reviews.Author: silverdudie
Reviews.Content: Well, I guess in order to be on the edge of the trend, hotels are going mad! May be one needs to be in their 20s or 30s to enjoy this place.... Our room was too cluttered.. Too many items... Hand shower didn't work, the curtain didn't close all the way & the floor was totally wet... BTW..... We arrives around 6 pm, checked in, got our card key to the room & when entered, the young man was busily changing our sheets....... Room was not ready for an hour!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Treatment by Housekeeping :)”
Reviews.Author: Renu B
Reviews.Content: I suffer from a severe allergy to scents/chemicals. A few days before arriving at the SLS Beverly Hills, I contacted the head of housekeeping via email, Daniela Hiles. She responded promptly and advise me they would be extra mindful of preparing my room without scents/chemicals. She even said she'd prepare my room a few days in advance and open the windows in order to have it aired out for my arrival! To top it off, she tried to upgrade my room free of charge (which unfortunately didn't happen due to high occupancy). My stay was completely scent-free, which never happens at high-end boutique hotels. Daniela and her team went way beyond the call of duty to make sure my experience was the best for my health. Thank you so much! The room was clean, comfortable and beautiful. I'll definitely stay there every time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “"The" Hotel to stay at when you are in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Judi0694
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills this past November. This property is absolutely beautiful. It is the perfect combination of elegance and chic. The rooms are appointed perfectly, bath products are wonderful, the pool area is totally hip as are the other common areas including the state of the art fitness center. While staying there you must dine at Bazaar! You will love this unique dining experience! I was not able to use the spa but it looked like it was first rate! Judi Griffiths

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Beyond.”
Reviews.Author: CESMPT
Reviews.Content: Words can simply not describe the fantastic experience I had at the SLS last weekend. From check in to check out each and every team member went over and above all of my expectations. Attention was paid to every detail including the room, lobby and restaurant. I would highly recommend a few nights at this extraordinary hotel. A special thanks to Aaron at the front desk and Brian at valet/bellhop. You both are a true asset to the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but dark and depressing”
Reviews.Author: tokyolady
Reviews.Content: The service was spectacular and the food at the restaurants was superb but somebody turn on the lights!! I reserved two rooms. The studio suite had two double?? beds but they really were twin size which was the reason that I reserved a second room for myself (I was staying with my nieces). The rooms are so dark, it is depressing. The halls, the lobby, everywhere.....and it felt so dusty and dank. I wouldn't visit this property again, I need sunlight.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay in a stylish and trendy locale!!”
Reviews.Author: Western_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Our group (grandparents, parents, infant grand-daughter) had a very nice multi-generational family stay here between Christmas and New Year's. We are all seasoned sophisticated travellers, always up for new experiences; but also appreciative of friendly and unpretentious service. We all found our stay at the SLS to be a very enjoyable and unique experience. The decor and ambience throughout the hotel is ultra-cool and trendy, and so was a lot of fun to experience. Staff in the hotel and associated restaurants were all friendly, welcoming, helpful; and there was no "attitude". We had an outstanding dinner at the attached restaurant Bazaar - expensive but great fun. As part of the dining experience be sure to check out the museum-like display area, and the trendy washrooms.We also had a great breakfast in Tres, the lobby restaurant. As part of your SLS experience you should splurge in both Bazaar and Tres at least once. The complimentary coffee at the self serve station in the lobby was a nice touch, as were the complimentary newspapers and trays of apples throughout. We also enjoyed a dip in the stylish roof-top pool, and there is a very well-equipped fitness center. Parking (valet only) is efficient but a little pricey at $35, and all business center services are for a fee (except for printing boarding passes). Internet access is $13/day from anywhere in hotel. (there is NOT free internet access in the business center, contrary to what is stated on the hotel web site. I confirmed with front desk.) The huge Beverly Center shopping mall is only a couple of blocks away.We had an excellent inexpensive self-serve breakfast at the Corner Bakery Cafe on La Cienega just across from the mall. The cafe has a large menu, and is much larger inside than it looks from the street. The Grand Lux Cafe across the street from the Bakery Cafe looks like another good choice. Don't leave the area without having driven iconic Mulholland Drive, and having taken in the views from some of the outlook pulloffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vak_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and had a wonderful stay. The location is great - walking distance to interesting shops and restaurants. The room was beautiful. The staff were very friendly and the concierge always gave me good recommendations for local outings. The pool/lounge area looked gorgeous - but it was a little chilly to experience it during my trip. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved almost all aspects of the hotel and would look forward to staying here again. We loved the room and the service was top notch. We also really liked the pool area. The staff really seemed to make an effort to take care of the guests. It was also a very good location for many of the things that we wanted to do. On the other hand, the food and drink were good, but a total rip off. It was way overpriced for what you received. I margarita in a small plastic cup by the pool was $20. I was also not very impressed with the size of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Not Critical - Just Saying”
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: The Service was excellent here and very accommodating - however I am not a difficult person; I can only imagine the awful behavior the staff here must encounter. The clientel is a bit much, and the thought the spaces are well planned and finished - I resented being manipulated by Phillipe Stark design form lobby to room. The pool deck is nice but very cramped with stangers sharing a chair with no space between. The guest room was like a Gucci showroom - all bronzed mirrors and grey carpet - lovely and over the top luxury. The shower is a porno shower completely clad in mirror and well rather fun... If you engage with the staff they will be very kind and polite. Worth cashing in all my travel points to stay for free. Drinks are crazy expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Creative Architecture & Elegant Ambience”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying here & still really enjoy the atmosphere & ambiance. Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed this time with my stay. I booked two rooms & my second room was not ready until almost 5:00pm. I was lucky enough that a new front desk person that was able to release a room from a VIP guest who was not expected in until late. I got to my room and called for room service for a blow dryer in which I waited 45 minutes for. After a poor start, things did get better. To sum things up: 1. Great property & atmosphere 2. Not very SPG friendly (don't expect an upgrade even at Platinum) 3. Room service will take a long time 4. Must be VIP to get excellent service 5. Well equipped fitness room 6. Bazaar bar & restaurant excellent 7. Nice roof pool

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious luxury and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Jminca
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay at the SLS. My own bed at home is a high end incredibly comfortable bed and yet I slept like a baby. (I NEVER sleep well at a hotel. ) The service was top notch yet low key and welcoming. The room was well decorated and inviting, as was the large private terrace (worth it). The same magic that general manager Thomas Meding brought to the Parker Palms Springs has followed him to the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Your personal safety is at risk at the SLS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercedes27
Reviews.Content: I am a well seasoned traveller who normally stays at 5 star hotels such as the Four Seasons in most major cities. I made the mistake on a recent visit to Los Angeles of staying at the SLS Hotel for about 4 nights. My expectation in a rated luxury hotel is that my room will be safe for me personally and that any belongings I have in the room will be safe. Not so at the SLS. We had purchased some clothing at Barney's and left it in the shopping bag in the room. Upon check out we noticed that the bag had vanished. That's when the so called Luxury Hotel showed it's true colours. I immediately called security about the missing bag and a security person came to the room and wrote a report. As we were in the process of checking out I was told I would hear back from the security officer within a few hours. Upon check out I asked for the General Manager as I wanted to make sure he knew of the incident. As he was not available I made sure the front desk was aware of the situation and asked that a message be left for him to call me. About 4 hours later after not receiving a call back as promised from the security person I called the hotel only to find he was not available but would return my call. This back and forth went on for about 6 weeks with no results of their investigation. I had also talked to Sarah the General Manager's assistant a number of times and asked her to have the General Manager call me but to no avail. I never recieved a call from the General Manager. Eventually after leaving several messages for their lead investigations person he did call and tell me that the results of their investigation had turned up nothing and of course they would not be reimbursing me anything as it was my word against their word. There were suggestions made by this individual that there were perhaps other ways they could look after me and he would get back to me on that but I never heard anything further. In all my years of travelling I have never had a worse experience than this hotel delivered to me. It's been 3 months since the loss occurred and all I have is further long distance telephone bills trying to get answers from these totally incompetent people. If safety and service is important to you do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Beverly Hills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: camachomarie
Reviews.Content: We used our points to stay at the SLS for 3 nights even though it is just down the street from us. When booking I noted the price range for the room was $350-$450 depending on night we were staying. There is parking on the streets in the neighborhoods by the SLS you just need to be very careful and read the street signs because you will get a ticket. The most we had to walk was 3-4 blocks. I am fairly cheap and didn't want to pay the $30+ for valet parking. If you don't mind walking it wasn't hard for us to find a decent spot. When we arrived the entrance was a little confusing because they have the Baazar entrance and then the hotel entrance on the side. It took us a moment to get it. There wasn't any line at check in and the front desk was very friendly and helpful. He did say he was upgrading our room to one with a terrace (outdoor patio). I'm not sure how much of an upgrade this is from a standard room, but it was nice to have since the weather was beautiful at the time. There wasn't a view from the patio, but it was comfortable. My only complaint about it was there wasn't any light. We wanted to sit out there and have some dessert one night. I ended up moving one of the lamps so we could see. The 4 stars is because this is a very trendy hotel and I wouldn't pay $400/night to stay here. I have been to many resorts in Hawaii, Mexico etc that are nicer for less money. Rooms - The rooms were very clean and housekeeping did an impeccable job. One night they even gave us a turndown service with some chocolates. My only complaint about the room was the layout. I hit my shin on the corner of the bed at least 3 times. I have the bruise to prove it. This may be because I am clumsy since Mr. C didn't do it once, but I don't think there was enough room between the table and the bed. I always had to remember to be extra careful. We didn't get a room with a bathtub, which I would have loved to relax in. Next time I will remember to ask how to get one of these rooms. I loved the products and wanted to take them home with me, but they come in large containers that are used again. I have seen a lot of people had problems with the lighting, but it didn't bother me. I was able to put my makeup on just fine and was able to see. One of my favorite parts of the room was the extra blanket on the bed. It was super comfy and I never let Mr. C use it. Service - Everywhere we turned the service was excellent. One day we had to have the plumber come up (don't ask why). He was there in less than 5 minutes and fixed the problem right away. We were having technical difficulties hooking our laptop up to the TV and they sent an engineer up right away. Although he wasn't able to figure out the problem right after he left I was able to get it to work. One morning when I was leaving the front desk called me by name and told me to have a good day. He totally caught me off guard, but it was a nice touch that he knew who we were. When leaving on our last day I'm not sure if they saw us coming but we were greeted at the elevator and asked if we needed help with our bags. At checkout I noticed we had been charged for some minbar items that we never used. The front desk didn't ask questions and credited my account for them. The location isn't the perfect Beverly Hills location, but their are plenty of restaurants near by and you are within a short drive to many things ( Hollywood, Sunset, Rodeo etc). I enjoy the happy hour at Gyu-Kaku. Although we didn't eat at Bazaar this time around I have been there before and the food is some of the best I have ever had. The prices are steep but worth every penny. On the weekends the bar is pretty happening and is the trendy LA scene if that is what you are looking for. We didn't use the rooftop pool or gym, but both look amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Hollywood Royalty! The Only Place to in LA”
Reviews.Author: 5kings
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in less than three months at the SLS Beverly Hills. I point this out because my wife and I are people that love different hotel experiences and rarely stay at the same hotel. We've stayed at the Beverly Hills Hotel, L'Hermitage, Four Seasons but after that first stay at the SLS, we couldn't wait to go back. So much so that I had won a weekend stay at another luxury hotel and I choose to PAY to stay at the SLS again. From the moment you arrive,you feel like a movie star. The hotel staff is one of the best I encountered. Whether it was the valet or the housekeeping staff, everyone treats you like you are their primary concern. It is truly a level of service that you read about in travel magazines but rarely get to experience. The restaurants and room service are all run by Jose Andres, an innovative chef who's The Bazaar at the hotel is one of the hottest tables in LA. All of our meals at the hotels were unbelievable and again the staff were some of the most accommodating and courteous we've encountered.
