Be sure to have breakfast at Tres and have the French toast(like s bread pudding). At night, have a drink at the bar next to The Bazaar and order the Jose Andres Gin and Tonic or a Margarita with salt air foam. Keep your eyes peeled for celebrities as they flock here. After you check in, you'll enter an elevator with "other guests" muraled on the walls upon exiting your floor, you'll see a pool table with the words "Satan Loves Sinners" stitched on the side. There's an electronic painting of a victorian era man than slowly changes into a monkey. Your room is as funky as the rest of the hotel. Amazing beds, modern decor, and a tv hidden within a mirror. The roof top bar looks like something out of a movie set with a beautiful and attentive staff to match. The gym and spa leave nothing to be desired. You literally forget you are in one of the most congested parts of Los Angeles within the walls of the SLS. They also offer a chauffeured car for short trips. You can't help but feel like one of the Hollywood elite when you stay here. And you should because all the SLS staff treats you like one! Take my word and stay here on your next trip to Los Angeles. My hat is off to the General Manager of the hotel who not only directs this fine staff but heard about a special event we were celebrating and made our stay extra special. Keep up the amazing work! We'll be seeing you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good, let down by dark room and mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: On paper, the SLS *should* be my top hotel in LA. It's well located, it's Starwood (as I try and stay in Starwood hotels wherever possible), trendy, and has some great restaurants both in the local vicinity and attached to the hotel, including Mortons, which is decent, and The Bazaar by Jose Andres which is supposed to be stunning but I'm yet to try. The rooms are very well designed, the gym's 24 hour, the room service menu is solid... so why I am complaining? Firstly, the rooms are very, very, very dark - the extent that seeing the contents of your suitcase is difficult, even with all the lights on maximum, and good luck getting ready, because even the bathroom's don't contain any bright lights at all. Which I understand is cool and relaxing and trendy etc, but a total nightmare if you want to style your hair - or for females - apply makeup. I was constantly seeing myself in the hall mirrors upon leaving my room and being horrified. But I guess my issue is with the service - it never seemed to be quite up to par for a hotel of this standard. Check in was downright unfriendly. I don't expect to have the red-carpet rolled out (although as a Platinum SPG member, it often is), but some basic politeness would sure be nice. As part of the benefits of SPG Platinum, you receive guaranteed upgrades to the best rooms available - and whilst that doesn't always happen, you're generally told "Sorry Sir, we're actually fully booked, so although you're a Platinum member we won't be able to improve your room, but will being whatever we can to make your stay great". I wasn't told anything, but when I asked if any better rooms were available, I was simply told "No". Long story but the short answer is, don't come here expecting any superior treatment for spending a huge amount of money with Starwood each year - you won't get it. As it happens, I had booked a suite anyway so the lack of a huge upgrade wasn't a huge issue, but as a top-level member of the hotel chain's loyalty scheme staying in a $400 suite booked with cash (not SPG points or anything), I would have expected a slightly better attitude. That sort of experience seemed to be a running theme throughout my four nights. For every helpful, ready-to-serve individual you'd encounter, they'd be another who let the whole place down. I called down at 11pm to try and arrange a laundry collection and was flatly told "The laundry opens at 9am Sir". "But can't you come and get my laundry now, for the morning?" I asked, as tends to be the procedure in any decent hotel, and was told again "Sir, the laundry opens at 9am". After calling back, frankly bewildered and asking to speak to a supervisor, I was told "Oh, I didn't understand what you meant. I'll send a bell-hop now". Er, yeah. I could go on, but I guess you get the drift. The concierge who seemed utterly unconcerned that I waited 15 minutes for a taxi when I was clearly bugged at running late for dinner. The fact that my mini-bar wasn't restocked once during a four day stay. The room-service chicken with mashed potato that came without mashed potato. It goes on. In short, it's good. It could be a lot better. Next time in LA, I'll be back staying at The London, which is a very similar sort of hotel and only about a mile away, but where they *do* get the service right. And when you're paying this much, they should.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Bubsche
Reviews.Content: Well, there is not much to say about this one. All you can expect from a beautiful hotel like this came true. Great service, outstanding food ( had the breakfast and was at The Bazaar ). Everybody is very friendly and I will come back for sure ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for enjoying all the best of LA”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelguy
Reviews.Content: WOW, what a place! Very stylish, comfy, excellent bar, excellent location, great concierge. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to enjoy some of the best of LA. And ask the concierge for nightlife help. They will get you in some Hollywood hotspots......

Reviews.Title: “chic but some downsides”
Reviews.Author: Earlham99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the SLS while in town for my SIL's bridal shower. I liked the outdoor living room that they have set up on the front porch, but the interior is a bit weird. I don't know how to describe it - urbanist ecclectic or mish mash. I overheard one guest say that he had a giant picture of Sean Combs in this room. And I'm still not sure how I feel about the giant backlit glass deer trophies hung all over the 1st floor space. The restaurant is different than Baazar but Jose Andres is the executive chef. It is set up like a series of living rooms with seating at couches around coffeetables or small tables. I will give the service at the restaurant good marks. We had the same server 2 days in a row and he was very pleasant. And the food was great. absolutely the best yogurt that I have ever had! All the food was excellently prepared and presented. Unfortunately, Baazar was closed for a private event so we couldn't eat there. I would agree with other reviewers that the property is DARK. The lobby, the reception area, the elevator area, the guest rooms. DARK, DARK, DARK. I got an eyelash in my eye and it was really hard to see it because the bathroom was so poorly lit. Although the bathtub was cool (free standing with water coming out of the ceiling to fill it). I also didn't think the bed was that comfortable (I prefer the Heavenly bed at the Westin). The fitness room was well equipped. And it was the only place in the whole hotel that WASN'T dark! Overall I am giving the hotel good marks because of the quality of the service, the location and the vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: Nothing but problems on my stay at the SLS! They messed up on my room reservation and it took them three hours to correct while I waited in the wrong room without any communication of what the problem was from the front desk. The rooms are so dark, the ironing board is so small you couldn't even iron a sock in it. The shower leaked all over the bathroom and the sliding glass door to the patio took mass might to open. I Called the conceriege for a club reservation and they said they were too busy and to call back. The pool attendant is a complete rag and puts reserved signs on all the chairs even though they never ended up being used that day. I give this hotel a 3 only because of its location, comfort, and design. If you like this location stay at the sofitel down the block or if you are looking for similar style and "scene" in a hotel stay at their other hotel The Redbury in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Cool digs. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: ZZtravels51
Reviews.Content: I have been resisting staying here as I am not a fan of Sam Nazarian's sbe. Usually his restaurant/club establishments are just scenes with no substance with mediocre decor. Not the case at SLS. I have to be a fan of Sam now because he hired two visionaries to create an awesome experience: Phillipe Starck and Jose Andres. The design is fantastic. Interesting, comfortable, and whimsical. Very luxurious and a little pretentious (it's LA after all). Check in was easy and front desk was friendly and efficient. The room is really trippy. Bed is in the middle of the room, bathroom is all slate and tinted mirrored glass.Little trinkets all over the room (for you to purchase, of course). The room was EXTREMELY clean, which I was a bit surprised about due to the complexity of the room and the amount mirrored surfaces. My only criticism is that the bed could be a bit more comfortable. By no stretch of the imagination would I say it is uncomfortable, but considering how great the room was it was a little disappointing. Also the chaise lounge wasn't very comfortable. The lobby bar was well decorated, served terrific drinks, and had a good crowd. The pool area was a bit cluttered. They need to do a better job here due to the competition of Hollywood rooftop pools. I didn't eat in the restaurant this time around, but have in the past and it is delicious and fun. I did order room service however, which was delicious and prompt. I ordered it through the SLS mobile app which they advertise all over the place. This was a fun feature that I'm sure will catch on at other luxury properties. Allows you to pre-order room service (did it the night before, got a call 15 minutes before my order time just to confirm), request housekeeping, book restaurant and spa reservations, get your car from valet, among other things. If I was staying longer I definitely would have taken more advantage of this feature. Besides the firmness of the bed, this was definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed at on the West Coast. Plus them being a part of Luxury Collection means starwood points! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, atmosphere, decor and food - unique stay”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Location: very good, close to lots of activities and minutes walking to shopping centers. Ambience: very special feel, the hotel’s lobby and restaurants are uniquely designed with a mix of extravagance-kitsch-gimmicks-exclusivity. It feels great to stay in this hotel – you feel as if you are part of something happening. Service: very good, although staff seem to take themselves too seriously. (It’s the guests who are VIPs not the staff!) Reception: fast, efficient Food: the restaurants and food are outstanding, and the way they present it, with high attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “SO CLEAN, I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cutiepieM
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if it was a good idea to have booked this hotel, since we were traveling with kids and I thought it maybe only for a crowd without kids who enjoy the Hollywood Nightlife. I am glad I was proven wrong. It is a great hotel. Very clean. Our room was spotless (and let me tell you I really felt bad for the housekeepers, whose job must be very tough---cleaning all the mirrors....). Our room was spotless! The bed was really comfy. The pool upstairs was great, and the guy working the bar was very nice and pleasant. Also, the Valet guys did a great job. Why did I take off one point? I wish you could open the windows---I just like to have some fresh air, instead of using the AC... Oh I forgot to mention room-service. Prices are kind of high, but I still enjoyed the Guacamole Sandwich very much, and the kids loved their choices of the Kids Menu. I have to say, next time I come to LA, I want to stay in this hotel again! It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “For Starwood Status maintainance only”
Reviews.Author: Justine W
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way home to help maintain Starwood status. The property is relatively old and has been updated. The designer did not consider functionality in the update. There was minimal lighting in the room and bathroom making it hard to apply make up. We had to put suitcases under the few recessed lights in the room to see at all. There is no lighting to turn off at the bedside or reading lights. The bed is in the middle of the room with sharp corners on the frame--I banged my shin. The rooms still have the feel of an old hotel. The pool area is very nice and the lunch menu was good and tasty. The property is not very centrally located to the main shopping area of Beverly Hills but there is a complimentary drop off service and Danny the driver was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and housekeeping did a great job.”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumJeffrey
Reviews.Content: Anniversary trip with my wife. Great stay. Many Benz's and better in the parking lot. Quite a bit of Beverly Hills attitude in the bar with posers trying to someone they're not. The hotel itself was great. Great location, very accommodating staff and good service. Rooms are pretty dark and need to be brightened up with better lighting. Wife says bathroom was definitely designed by a man. Great place. Daniela in housekeeping was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Bring night vision goggles and dont expect top service but still go!”
Reviews.Author: RSKI213
Reviews.Content: Spent five night here two weeks ago. It is very dark, almost too dark. Wife had trouble with makeup in the room it was so dark. Other than that it is a very nice property. Food was wonderful, had room service on multiple occasions. Rooms are large but be prepared for Miami Vice meets adult movie set. Very modern but again very spacious and nice amenities. Only thing lacking at this property is the attitude of some of the staff. There seems to be no desire to go above and beyond. I normally stay at the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills. Very different service level there. The staff was not rude and got the job done there was just nothing special about the service. Perfect example... After spending a lot of money at the spa my wife and I decided to just change and shower back in our room (about 20 yards from the spa). As we were walking out we were told we needed to bring back the robes or we would be charged $100 each. No problem but there was an attitude of we were inconveniencing them for taking the robes. Not what I would expect in a hotel of this caliber. They could have easily said, we will send somebody to pick them up etc. Just the way it was done was typical of the whole place. That would not happen at the Four Seasons. Overall all though it is a nice property. Just don't expect five stat service.

Reviews.Title: “SWANKY”
Reviews.Author: DominicParamore
Reviews.Content: Was not disappointed by anything in particular, but at the same time was not overwhelmed by the staff nor the hotel itself. It was more gimmicky than comfortable, we had breakfast downstairs in front of our own fireplace, but the table and couch were very difficult to eat at comfortably. The location is great to take advantage of all the great shopping in the area, so that is one of the best assets of the hotel. We selected the hotel because we had reservations at the hotel restaurant, so not sure we would return again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service... Can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: claybrizendine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS on a Saturday night, moving there from another hotel, because it was closer to those things that I would be doing on that particular night. I used my Starwood points and booked a room there, not sure what I was getting myself into. When I left, I said that I'd never stay at another hotel in the LA area if I didn't have to. From a location standpoint, you can't go wrong. For those that have been to LA, you know how spread out it is, and if there were a 'central' location to a lot, this would be it. The hotel itself was magnificient. It was incredibly popular and packed with people, but still maintained a somewhat cozy feel. My room was incredibly appointed, with the highlight being the dark-mirrored wall with the TV directly in the center of it. The bathroom had a standing shower only and plenty of modern amenities. I appreciate that they had bottles of soap, shampoo, etc. that were large enough that you only used what you needed and that the hotel wasn't going to throw away an entire bottle of liquid just because I used a little bit. The fitness room was the best in any hotel I've stayed in. Two rooms big, one side maintained cardio equipment while the other had the circuit resistance machines. What set it over the top was that it had two, $10,000 each Kinesis machines from TechnoGym. These things are out of this world cool looking and work you out incredibly well. There was a really packed restaurant and bar on the 1st floor that I did not eat at, but given the popularity and star rating, I've heard it was good :) All in all, I would return in a second. My favorite hotel used to be the W San Francisco, but this one has replaced it. You will not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Need to get better at blocking & tackling”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: SLS is certainly stylish but I found the lack of basic luxury hotel standards to be a serious detractor from the overall experience. 1. No doorman / generally unhelpful welcome at the door. You only get one chance at a good first impression and SLS whiffed here. Waited around for a valet, couldn't figure out which entrance to go to, and nobody was there to take our bags. 2. Rooms. Biggest issue: the beds are too small. I am 6'2, which is not enormous, and my feet were hanging off of them. Also didn't have an iPod player... really? 3. Bathroom. The worst part. They have a bunch of toiletries in the bathroom which I thought was a nice touch until I realized you had to PAY for them. How tacky. Second, the bathtub/shower combo is just bizarre- the shower head is in the ceiling and water splashes all over the floor outside the bathtub. Finally, they have that horrible hotel trend where the bathroom doors slide open to the room - as if anyone wants to look in or out the bathroom from the rest of the room. 4. In general the place seemed kind of dingy. Needs new carpets. The things they do well: 1) The rooftop pool is tight. 2) The bar drinks are good and the place is generally a scene. 3) The location is pretty good - not PRIME Beverly Hills but close enough.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: salijo h
Reviews.Content: SLS has a great staff, everyone new my name and was always very interested. My daughter unfortunately was in Cedars-Sinai hospital for two weeks and i chose the SLS Hotel for its location..The service was grand and my stay was fabulous considering why i was there for my daughter... but every evening i could come back to my very comfortable room...and new i could completely relax as it was a home away from home. The team of employees were very aware, kind and sensitive. The SLS is very fortunate to have such a industrious and thoughtful staff...kudos to Rachael and Avery who made my stay extremely enjoyable...mydaughter is well !!!

Reviews.Title: “SLS stands for slow luxury service.”
Reviews.Author: Luis90220
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel staff was great. Everyone was very helpful and was truly there to give me great service. Until the next day when I ordered ice for my room right before I went out and I ended up waiting a whole hour just for them to bring it out to me. I had to call three times to check to see when it was going to arrive and they kept telling me 15 min and that someone was already on there way. Because of this it made my night less eventful since I wasted a whole hour just waiting on something that should be so simple to get. I can only imagine if I would've asked for more. Which I did when I arrived back from being out. I ordered in room dining from the kitchen. I ordered two WELL DONE cheeseburgers but instead got plain hamburgers and then not cooked thoroughly. It wasn't even cooked at all. It was undercooked and when I informed the kitchen they said we ordered hamburgers and were only sorry for them not being cooked. Yet still made me sign the bill for it. The only good thing is that the next day during check out I informed the front desk and they took care that issue for me. Which only meant they gave me awful food for free. Nothing else. I wouldn't Really recommend to anyone to order in room dinning service since they just don't seem to know what they're doing there.

Reviews.Title: “Great but the price is NOT right for what you get”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshirePeppie
Reviews.Content: I'll preface by saying this was my first luxury experience. I don't regret it. A ton of fun. HOWEVER, personally more comfortable in the "regular Sheratons" that give you lots of amenities without the frills. I was appalled at what I paid and how little I got. No paper at your door, no room coffee. Everything in room was extremely expensive. The pool is GORGEOUS. Cold though and very surprised no hot tub. Was freezing after my dip and off to the fitness center only to be told the steam room use was $30! This is after paying well over $300 for our room! The decor is very funky but not my style. Both my friend and I thought this was a very male place with hunting/man cave motif. The room wasn't really user friendly. Very dark with phallic long lights. Fun but not fun-ctional! The best part was the amazing tender loving care by Natasha both at the pool and the restaurant. She really pampered us and was just delightful. Also Danny who did the room orientation and made us feel right at home. It was a lifetime experience to stay in the heart of Beverly HIlls and experience the star treatment but not my cup of tea. We were there for Dancing with the Stars and it was a blast! The food is totally divine! Hadn't realized this is the top chef in the area and the flavors are magical. The chocolate molten cake with cardamom foam is still appearing in my dreams! MOST of the staff was above and beyond but so much surprised me. No door man and a big door to maneuver. Many don't acknowledge you or say hello. The concierge was great! Frido was so much fun and so good to us. The curbside desk staff woman was uninformed and not at all friendly. Really surprised me they had her as the first impression as it was NOT a good first impression but once you go inside to the concierge, you feel the reason this is a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and differant”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in an upper floor. It was not high enough though as we had a view of a parking lot. The hotel has that modern flair and it was nicely set up. The rooms are somewhat on the small side and I do have to agree with the darkness. Although it is kind of sexy and romantic lighting, it would be noice to have an option for brighter if needed, especially in the bathroom when getting ready to go out. The bed was very comfortable and the set up of room was well laid out. The wardrobe cabinet was nice as well. We had good service and enjoyed the rooftop pool for just relaxing by. It is a small and shallow pool, but it does its job. For the area, you do have to pay more for hotels, so I guess it was average.

Reviews.Title: “A grown up W or a St. Regis on Geritol”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Take the best of a W hotel and add some class and remove the high school kids and here you are. Lots of fun, good spa and an amazing fitness center. it would be worh staying here for the hotel but add that the resturants are done my Jose Andres and The Bazaar is here and it is no brainer. Rooms are very neat

Reviews.Title: “ok proberbly wont return”
Reviews.Author: dad26
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern, clean and the staff couldn’t do enough to accommodate. However it had a very dark theme. In the room there was barely any light and it was impossible to read. The brightest place in the hotel was probably the lift! The location was good but was surrounded by construction It’s not a place to take the family, i do not think it was good value for money and I doubt that I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Beverly Hills Luxury and Hip Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlier2010
Reviews.Content: I spent several months (for business) as a guest at the SLS. The accomodations are up-to-date and the location is fantastic. While this property is quite a hot spot for action (bazaar bar next door and roof-deck pool) the rooms are comfortable and quite. The decor is "funky - minimalist" and very cool. The spa is fantastic and the associates from every department of the property are polite and welcoming. The gym is ample size with quality equipment. Adequate business center and in-room wi-fi. Macs available in upgraded rooms. Although my primary reason to stay was business, it was a wonderful location and I had my wife fly in to stay with me on several weekends. I highly recommend this property. If you're a "star-gazer," I saw several celebs during my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Some oddities at this property”
Reviews.Author: LReego
Reviews.Content: While the location is fine for LA and the restaurant Bazaar is excellent, the interior already seems dated to me on just my third visit. As a commercial designer who travels around the world frequently, I may be more particular, but when a hotel owner chooses a style that is trendy, as this one has, that look does not have lasting power... for example, the shot of JZ in the common area (??) Or the lamp on the large horse... Or the photographs on the elevators walls....fun to see the first time, then it seems old. We also think that the rooms were not well-planned. The bathroom is separated by a sliding glass door which is not sound-proof. I've been married 25 years and still don't want to hear my husband in the bathroom in the morning... and I'm sure he feels the same way about me ....! The room we had did not have a view... just the side of another building... But the beds are comfy and the staff was attentive...but for the price, I can't muster the four stars...

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service! SLS is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Krista A
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago I was fortunate enough to stay at SLS. Everyone, from the valet to the front desk, exceeded my expectations and were beyond accommodating. The decor and ambiance are fun, eclectic and modern. The rooms are unique and unlike any hotel I've ever stayed at. Upon checking in I literally asked if I was in a "standard" room because it was very impressive. It was all very inspiring! I returned 1 week later and conducted a ton of interviews. The Tres Restaurant was the perfect location to tuck away in and the hostess, Lauren, and server, Lauren too, were AMAZING! I knew I was asking for a lot by planting myself there for several hours and they were happy to help and even keeping the flow of candidates in order. They understand how to service customers no matter how wacky our requests might be! Thanks to both Laurens at Tres for being so accommodating! I will return to SLS! In fact, I'm returning next week! You are my "go to" hotel in LA now!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Cameron F
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the SLS. I was absolutely happy with the staff, the experience and my room. I was visiting for the LA Wine & Food Festival and decided to stay at this hotel and I could not have chose a better place to stay. My room was absolutely gorgeous. My friends and I ate at the Bazaar, which is one of my favorite restaurants and highly recommend eating there, while staying at the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: markooz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but a view of an autobody shop and shared toiletries in a musty shower (no ventilation in the shower) isn't what I expect for $400+. This seems more like it should be an ALOFT. Bazaar, however, is wonderful. I will likely stay at the Sofitel nearby next time.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, kind of weird and in total not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: So we arrived yesterday, gorgeous place, check in was extremely attentive. The bellman gave us a wonderful dissertation on the hotel, the room, the amenities. We like quirky and this room with its quirkiness was appealing. Like others have said - the lighting is dim. Even at the work desk. There's no good place to sit and relax except on the bed. The couch is uncomfortable and yikes! When the maid put the blanket on the bed today that spent last night on the couch we discover the couch is horribly stained in multiple places! I've honestly never had to deal with an old mess like this in any hotel since my salad days. It's been more than two hours since I called the front desk about the situation AND pointed it out to the housekeeping guy so I guess we'll have to be content with sitting on the bed until we leave on Saturday. My biggest disappointment is not that there's no drawers to put my clothes away - have lived out of a suitcase before but that there's no tub in the bathroom. :( For me it's not a vacation if I can't have a nice long soak. We had a ton of points from SPG so staying here was not a huge financial outlay but I won't be staying here again. Funny - since I stayed here several times when this hotel was the Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel for all Types of Travelers”
Reviews.Author: FlyRight
Reviews.Content: I just visited LA for 4 days. Three nights in a hotel gives a good idea about the place. Before my arrival an employee identified as an Starwood Relations person at the hotel contacted me via email. I responded that I would like my two rooms facing away from the main street to lessen the noise. He took care of it for me. I also asked that he pass along a dinner reservation request to the concierge. He did. However, they never got back to me and I had to follow-up on the request myself. The hotel is ideally located in Beverly Hills and its car service is very helpful. Frank is a nice driver and very helpful- but could use some help on good restaurants to visit. The hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful throughout the stay; we didn't see any attitude at all. I saw all type of guests from businessmen, to artsy posers, to movie executive types. My premium room was very modern and quite large. The bathroom is large for a regular room hotel, and it is covered in mirrors. If you don't like your body be ready to be depressed or motivated! We ate at Tres for light food and drinks, which was very good. There isn't a coffee maker in the room, but they serve very good free coffee in the lobby in the morning. I agree with a prior review that a regular ironing board is needed in the rooms. The little ones just don't work. I did have a problem with my phone and it took two requests to the front desk to fix it; the smoke detector was fixed with the first request. Someone had clearly disabled it; I am surprised it was caught before check-in. Overall this hotel is very good and a cool place all around. Lots of neat atmosphere one would expect in LA. Beware that parking is $35 night.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Luxurious Stay.”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: These days when I travel to LA I stay at the SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills. Pulling up to this hotel is an experience! You can' t help but feel like a celebrity as you pull into the driveway of this perfectly manicured property. Valet is always quick and efficient. A brief walk up a (what else) red carpet and you're in a stunning lobby filled with high end Philippe Starck furniture and decor. For a design buff, I love catching new glimpses of all the amazing furnishings. Check in here is always flawless and each time I've been upgraded to a great room. One to a patio room, one to a higher floor/view room and one to a signature suite. All amazing. I'd be happy to occupy any and all at any time. The elevators in the hotel are cheeky and whisk you tog serene floors again filled with whimsical furniture. Other elements of this hotel that are noteworthy include the amazing rooftop pool and bar. Of course, this is LA and it's going to be expensive. Once you stomach that you'll have a great time sipping on the $20 mojitos. The bars and restaurants are sweet as well. Try Bazaar. Amazing good and drinks with an equally brilliant layout and design. I can't say enough about this place. Simply Luxurious Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beverly Hills location, convenient to Beverly Center”
Reviews.Author: 3fortheride
Reviews.Content: Modern, hip hotel with excellent dining and nightlife. Rooms are comfortable with everything you would expect in a high-end property. If planning on working, the lighting is a little weak.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: This was an interesting hotel. Like a W, it's stylish, but you might call the SLS hyper-stylish as there's so much attention to detail in both the rooms and public areas. The halls, rooms and check-in areas are all kind of dark, but I found that to be positive and somewhat relaxing. The rooms are fairly spacious and laid out in a way that makes them seem larger (lots of mirrors helped) and I loved the big flat screen TV mounted into the wall. The bathrooms were large and the showers were so great that I didn't miss having a soaking tub. I also liked how the bathroom had a bit sliding wall over the sink so you could slide the bathroom open and look out into the rest of the room. Room service was stellar. It came quickly, but what was really great was the food. I think it all comes from the same kitchen that services The Bazaar, a Jose Andres restaurant. Service at the front desk was friendly, but what I really noticed was how efficient they were as there was hardly ever a line at the desk, even though I was there during a fairly busy time. The room didn't have coffee pots, but I asked for one and within 10 minutes I had a coffee pot. So if you don't want to order your coffee from room service or hike to the Bean & Tea Leaf, just ask for a pot. And finally, the location. It was convenient, but only if you have a car. It is within walking distance of a mall and other shops, but this particular area of L.A. is not particularly pedestrian friendly and walking even a fraction of a mile felt awkward if not a little dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal415
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel- nice decor, good in-room amenities, centrally located. Positives- Short cab ride away from most LA spots, hip room design, very cool bathrooms, clean, attracts cool groups of people, nice rooftop pool (albeit very small), this is your place if you like mirrors- they are everywhere! Shortcomings- Not impressed with staff at all (valet did not open door, no bell hop available, took forever to get service at pool), rooms are VERY dark even when you have all the lights on, pool deck gets VERY crowded so arrive early unless you want to pay $250 for small cabana or $400 for large one (comes with 2-4 pool chairs) I would stay here for a girls/guys trip or with a significant other- much better hotel than the Sunset options. I wouldn't stay here solo or for a business trip (not practical to work in dark room and didn't appear to have business amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Sexy”
Reviews.Author: Sf903
Reviews.Content: This hotel frOm it's decor to the restaurant theme to the mirrors oozes sexy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: SHS31
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for a few days recently. We loved it! The hotel is very chic & stylish, which we love. The rooms are spacious, beds are very comfortable, bathrooms are sexy but functional, and the pool area is clean & wonderful. I was celebrating my birthday and the concierge team upgraded our room to a terrace room which was so fantastic. We dinned at The Bazaar and LOVED the food, service, and ambiance. A huge THANK YOU to Aaron of the concierge team. He made our entire stay completely magical. We look forward to going back to the SLS very soon! It is our new home in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for city visit, not that family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Froimo
Reviews.Content: This is a funky and trendy place in a great location. The rooms, even the suites are not that big and fairly dark. The pool is tiny with limited space to lay down around it. Though nobody goes there! Great restaurants and occasional celebrity spotting. If you are SPG Platinum, don't expect an upgrade or any special treatment...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Sri V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at the SLS. The manager and the staff went above and beyond the call of duty in making our experience memorable including champagne in our rooms, providing us with the hotel limo to take us to dinner and a personalized experience at the hotel spa. I can't say enough about their professionalism and service. We cannot wait to go back to SLS. Thanks Aaron!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: kitty-hello
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best around the Beverly Hills area. It's easy to find while very close to the shopping center nearby. Very trendy and therefore, it's kind of dark everywhere. There's a nice restaurant downstairs, young couples, people watching. However, I still think the room is kind of small. But it was a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Hanto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to see what all the hype was about, and as it turns out the hotel is really impressive. On first impression walking through the front door you are met by a beautifully designed hotel, every piece if art, every chair, has been chosen very carefully and the result is fantastic. I was little let down by the location, beyond the walls of the hotel the area seemed to under a constant state of construction, and is located on a very busy road, not that you notice it when inside at all, however if you are like me and like to go for a run, or a walk it does get a bit hectic. You are in LA after all I guess. I also spent sometime by the pool during the day, the drinks are strong (margarita's) and the staff where ver attentive. I was trying to work up there, however the wifi on the roof is impossibly slow so I had to give up. The views and the layout up there are awesome, its a great place to relax. All told I would say the hotel is worth a visit if you are into exploring luxury hotels. Enjoy.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, iffy location...but I'd definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: WOPDingo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed only one night at this hotel, part of the Starwood Luxury Collection, but it was still a very pleasant experience. I'd have to say that this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in the Starwood chain, to include numerous Ws and Westins, in various countries. Perhaps it's the relative newness of this property that lends itself to being so well-maintained. Regardless, the hotel rooms and public areas are very chic and ooze an upscale feeling, and the service was generally on par with, or above what I expect at the rates paid, and I was very happy. The exterior of the hotel is very nondescript, but not in a bland way. It's understated, which is a nice touch. Inside the valet area, though, is a completely different story; it looks exactly what I've pictured the porte-cochere of a Beverly Hills hotel to look like - lots of beautiful furniture and art, all very tastefully situated. It was what I imagine a Beverly Hills home to be like. All the valets, bellmen, and other hotel staff were very smartly dressed in shirts and ties, or business dresses. Everything at this hotel is very dark, with lots of dark tones, to include the uniforms. We were greeted by name everywhere we went, and services were offered promptly, courteously, and without attitude, which is something I unfortunately *did* expect. It was a very pleasant arrival experience. Check in was not as perfect as the valet/bell service. It wasn't bad by any means, though. We arrived at about 1:45 pm, a little before the general check-in time of 3 pm. I know that's not unusual, but that I shouldn't expect a room to be ready. What irked me a bit, though, was that several other parties decided to check-in early as well, which overwhelmed the front desk staff a bit - and only 2 of 3 check-in terminals were being used while several bellmen/concierge staff stood around. I would have appreciated if someone on staff would have noticed the line forming at the front desk, and called over another person to assure that all check-in stations were manned. This did not happen. One clerk was a trainee, but she was doing her best with what appeared to be a reservation with a bit of a hiccup. The other clerk was dealing with what I thought to be an overly-demanding-but-not-deserving guest who swore that she found a rate online for a particular suite, but nothing in SLS system said that was even remotely true. Both clerks handled the situations with grace and smiles. Kudos to them for that. As I said, it wasn't a bad experience at all, but I disliked having to wait 15 minutes to check-in when there was another station available. It just seemed like some disconnect in personnel management. However, it should be noted that the trainee, who eventually helped my partner and I, was very apologetic about the wait and overall incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was amazing. We only had the lowest grade of room available, but it was great. The decor was very posh, and done with impeccable taste. It's a blend of modern and maybe...art nouveau? Either way, the set up of the room itself, to the furniture used, to the bathroom were just remarkable. The pictures provided on this site will do a better job of showing the details of the room, but in my examination of the room itself, all the furniture was very, very well-kept and incredibly clean. The rooms contain a LOT of mirrored surfaced, to include, walls, tables, and the bed. And you can imagine what a nightmare that must be. Their housekeeping staff definitely has their work cut out for them, but appear to be doing a superb job. I have only one complaint about the room: All the mirrored walls have a smoke tint to them, making the rooms very dark, even with all the lights on. This is especially troublesome in the bathroom where sufficient light is necessary when getting ready to go out. Even though the bathroom mirror over the sink wasn't tinted, the other surfaces are, and they just seem to absorb all the light. The shower and the bounty of bathroom amenities almost make up for the dimness, though. The shower products come in large bottles, so you never have to worry about running out or opening tiny little vials of shampoo or conditioner with already-soapy/slippery hands. We used the valet and requested turn-down service. Every time we called the front desk or the valet, they were extremely gracious and accommodating. My partner and I aren't terribly needy, but felt as though any desire we would have expressed, would have been met with every effort to see it met. The location... It's just down the street from the Beverly Center and a short drive or a decent-ish walk to West Hollywood. However, the surrounding areas are light commercial and not the kind of area I'd necessarily think of for this kind of hotel, especially given the oasis you experience once inside the property. Perhaps this hotel, itself, is an effort to gentrify the area. Either way, though, the drive from the airport to the hotel left my partner and I wondering if this was the best choice. Again, I'd definitely return and the location *is* convenient, just don't be dissuaded by the surrounding neighborhood. I regret that we were only able to stay one night, as I would have loved to use the pool or the spa, and just experience a day or two more of the hotel. It's a great place and is definitely on my list of places to look at the next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and modern - more for the young and try hards”
Reviews.Author: sunloverVictoria
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 5 nights with a friend. The room was ready early which was great as we had just flown in from Australia. Very helpful and friendly concierge. Town car available for guests wishing to travel within a small radius of the hotel. Position great, just next door to the beverley centre, and walking distance to the grove and farmers market. Very clean, great service, comfortable quiet rooms, and a 24 hour fully equipped gym. Highly recommend the boot camp on saturday mornings. Lots of interesting things to look at. Very small roof top pool area, but very clean. The lighting is very limited, but it create a mood and we did not find it a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, plush hotel for the in-crowd”
Reviews.Author: LondonSS88
Reviews.Content: Trendy, plush hotel for the in-crowd in a convenient location. Stayed here for 5 nights. Didn't start off great as our room wasn't ready and once we got to our room, it took over an hour and 4 calls down to reception to get our bags sent up. Staff are very polite and professional. We thought the waiting staff in the bar would be quite snooty, but they proved us wrong and were really welcoming and friendly. They even gave us complimentary petit fours which were delicious. Special mention and thanks to Danny the bellhop for helping us move rooms 3 times after plumbing problems occured in our first room. Although reception said we would get upgraded to a suite, this didn't surface and we were moved to a smaller room twice, before settling in a room that was the same size as our original. The SLS had a really nice smell upon entering the lobby and on the guestroom floors. Rooms are spacious and clean but quite dark so we requested for extra lamps. Although the room looked amazing, we found the design of the furniture impractical, the wardrobe was very hard to open by it's fabric loop and we lost count of the amount of times we would catch ourselves on the metal frame of the bed and the chair. Walking distance to the Beverly Centre and a short cab ride to The Grove, Universal Studios, Santa Monica beach and Hollywood Boulevard. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful friendly service”
Reviews.Author: butravel
Reviews.Content: We live in the area but decided to try the hotel for one night. Lots has been said about the property that need not be repeated. It's mostly hip, for singles, and you couldn't do better. We are an older married couple but have stayed in enough quality hotels to know good service and very few can do better. Everyone was well trained and seemed to be genuinely helpful. Try their frozen Caipirinha in their bar. It's prepared almost as a ceremony to the Brazilian gods, minus a human sacrifice, unless you drink too many. We had a wonderful surprise email when we returned home. Our stay was paid for. All we had to do was to send personal information to some guy located in an unknown country for a $70 processing fee and he would in turn send us $2,8000,000.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and new”
Reviews.Author: LNANewJersey
Reviews.Content: My whole family loved this hotel. The modern furnishings and complete design by Philippe Starck were exceptional. Every detail in our room was well thought out and functional. Our stay here was fabulous and embodied what we as new visitors to L.A. envisioned; hip, cool, fun, and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: kikicorbs
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to write. My actual experience at the SLS was quite nice. However, my experience afterwards dealing with the gentleman(who shall remian nameless) in billing who took many weeks to rectify a large mistake really soured my feeling about my stay. Dealing with him was such a nightmare and he was so condescending that I probably wouldn't recommend the SLS. (Long story short, we had prepaid our stay for work yet my private credit card was still charged again for the room- thus leaving me witha very hefty charge on my own account- then was incorrectly refunded to my colleagues credit card by mistake instead of mine- you get the drift here....none of which was my fault and yet I never even really got an apology) So even though the room was quite stylish, the pool was delightful, and the dinner we had at the Baazar was amazing- it all still falls flat after my bad experience with the customer service afterwards. Hotels of this caliber have no excuse for poor and inept service in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: DavyVermeire
Reviews.Content: Had a room at the SLS hotel, and i was not satisfied. I checked out after a few hours. Rooms are very dark, not really clean (enough for me). The pool area was dirty... The service at the pool was bad. The waitress had dirty spots on her clothes, drinks served in small and cheap plastic cups... wondered how the water in the pool was if the surroundings and staff are not clean. SLS is designed well, maybe intentions are good... but it was not working for me. Above: there was nobody in the hotel: I think I was the only guest, strange & spooky!

Reviews.Title: “No Need to Leave the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: One minor issue kept this from being a five star hotel experience. The lighting was so sexy and subdued that we older folk had some issues seeing. A little more light as an option please. Overall the experience was terrific. We were upgraded to a suite, but I think the regular rooms would have been just fine. The room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. Modern without going crazy. Blackout shades on the windows made getting out of bed an option, not a requirement. The bathroom was beautifully outfitted with a great shower and clever sink, The color selection was terrific. There was also workout equipment, plenty of closet space, great robes, etc. All in all, the in room experience except for lighting was A-1. The hotel itself is quite stunning inside. Decoration is very hip. There are two main restaurants - Bazaar and Tres. We had eaten at Bazaar several times in the past when we lived in LA. This time we dined at Tres. Both restaurants serve excellent food and are beautiful to behold. For visitors to LA who need to be in the Beverly Hills-West Hollywood area, this is a great choice. No need to fight the Santa Monica east of downtown west traffic. Highly recommend the hotel. Not inexpensive but cheap by Beverly Hills standards.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool”
Reviews.Author: HohoSummit_NJ_USA
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel. Posh looking. Bed was very comfortable. I usually have problem sleeping through the night at a hotel. But not this one. I slept from 11 to 7 straight! The amazing thing is that they have face wash provided in the bathroom. I think everything about this hotel is pretty cool. More for the rich and beautiful than your grandpa and grandma type of places. Try the restaurant next door too. It is very good.

Reviews.Title: “OMG---lovely hotel, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Trave11er123
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I splurged and stayed in this hotel on a recent trip to LA. It had very unique decor and a happening atmosphere. Be sure to check out the Restaraunt downstairs, are to die for!! The pool is good, they do an interesting job of camouflaging the fact that they are in the middle oh a concrete jungle. There is a great mall within walking distance, and the Grove is not too far either. The gym is well appointed and the concierge was great at recommending local eateries, & hotspots. We had a snooty waitress at the downstairs lobby eatery :-( My only complaint would be that the rooms were a bit tight and could do with an extra light, but it was a luxurious hotel regardless. I may not stay here again ($$$), but I will recommend it as a place to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but execution lacking”
Reviews.Author: terere2
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here a couple of weeks ago. This is a hip hotel and the Bazaar restaurant (we didn't eat here) is highly regarded and a huge draw. I really appreciated the greeting by Aaron at valet but the check-in experience was a bit impersonal. An amenity didn't arrive until we made a couple of requests and the car wasn't brought around in a timely fashion even though we called well in advance of departure for the Hollywood Bowl. Concierge was friendly and helpful and the gym is fantastic. The pool is a fun scene. Overall, this hotel has great bones but there were a few service hiccups. I'd recommend it but at this price point there are lots of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bev1060
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our teenage boys and wanted to do the Hollywood thing. We stayed here for three nights, rented a car and toured Los Angeles. The hotel was very modern, huge flat screen T.V. and enormous bathroom with huge shower and lots of expensive amenities. The pool was mostly for sunning, the service for poolside bar was great but pool wasn't deep at all. We didn't eat there it really wasn't set up for family dining, however, there were numerous restaurants like Cafe Luxe at the mall one block away. Parking was expensive and had to be valet, but service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, hip, chic hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: elansp
Reviews.Content: Ultra trendy hotel. Extremely helpful staff. Good location. Nice pool. Good restaurants and bars on site. Only negative - complimentary car service doesn't start untl almost 11am.

Reviews.Title: “sophisticated, pleasantly dark, and super convenient”
Reviews.Author: alexanderkh
Reviews.Content: rooftop pool is great, bar drinks are strong and tasty, service is superb, and the dark reception is enticing! ;-) not to mention the quality of the rooms - excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: It’s not your standard hotel. SLS Beverly hotel has crossed the line into a new dimension of visual taste. The overall design is eclectic combining contemporary with classic and modern furnishings. Our floor had an area with a pool table. Our room had all the basic elements of a hotel room but was arrange much differently to accommodate the eclectic design. The TV was hidden behind the mirrored wall and the bathroom was nicely done in class and mirrors. The buffet area reminds me of Alice in Wonderland when you first walk in. The food selection was exceptional but not for the ordinary palette as well as the price. Overall, we had a great stay. The valet to the reservation desk were customer orientated.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: afubeca
Reviews.Content: Dirtiest hotel I have experienced in years. Carpet was filthy, shower smelled like mold felt like a frat house. At least it was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but trying too hard to be trendy”
Reviews.Author: PamandBradFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be The Merdian and was updated in the last three years when SLS took over the hotel. I stayed at The Meridian many times over the past ten years and always loved it. When we decided to travel to California for a family vacation, we chose this hotel based upon past experience even though it was under new ownership. SLS conducted a major overhaul of the hotel. The rooms were "funky chic." They were spacious and clean but dark. The bathroom was likewise large with a funky shower and bathtub but, again, too dark. More importantly, though, it was clean. We found the concierge to be snooty. We had a very long travel day and wanted something easy, close and casual to eat. Instead, they suggested a trendy and extremely expensive restaurant (appetizer salad $48.00). In other words, there was no consideration given to what we wanted and we felt as if we were bothering them as opposed to them assisting us. The breakfast buffet was very limited but the food was excellent. Their homemade Greek vanilla yogurt with berries was fantastic and the wait staff was down-to-earth, very friendly and eager to please. Our family is still talking about this yogurt. Seriously. From what we could gather, there did not appear to be any "funky chic" people staying at the hotel. We saw lots of families and business people so we were not sure who their target audience is. For the price point, the additional $36.00 per night for parking plus internet (per device) charges were excessive. For a hotel of this caliber, these items should be included in the room charge. We would most likely stay at another luxury hotel in the area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: elainie2c
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough good things about the hotel. From top notch service in all areas, to the fleet of BMW drivers waiting to drive you (complimentary within a certain radius), wonderful food in the lounge and dessert in their Bazaar restaurant. Its definitely anything but traditional, very much club like feel in the whole hotel, dim lighting, but for us it was perfect, room was unlike anything I've seen, very sleek and comfortable. The drivers were wonderful, we got a quick tour of Beverly Hills. I used Starwood points and only had to pay $90 and the room was great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: Lizzieg_67
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this to say that I used my points to book this for a family holiday as we were going to LA for the Xgames. We've been to LA lots of times and have stayed at nice hotels so we were excited to stay at this one. The car valet staff and extremely well mannered and polite and gracious. This was such a lovely way to welcome new guests. But, the dark hotel lobby and the dark rooms while conceptually innovative are not the kind of "Starck" I was hoping for. The rooms are dark - we heard this from all the staff too...they are dark...if you lose something on the floor, good luck trying to find it without a flashlight. If you happen to sit at the desk, please pay attention to the giant horn lamp and WATCH your head. Do not think about getting a chain saw to cut this down, the hotel will charge you for this (we heard that somebody else did this). The hotel pool is lovely and staff are courteous but be ready for posers, "vin diesel wannabes" and people wearing inappropriate shoes...i.e. not family friendly but trying too hard. Be warned, if you want to buy your own juice and milk for your own less expensive breakfast and clear out the bar, they will charge you for it. Not the best surprise at check out and added some extra dollars for nothing. This made me really disappointed at how badly the hotel wants to charge you for stuff especially when they don't even give you a coffee maker. So we left with mixed emotions :( We left as confused as we felt this hotel was about its identity. Not sure who this hotel is catering to yet...not sure if the hotel knows either. Best wishes though. Next time we are staying at Miramar in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Chic with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: SebnVero
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the SLS. Large suite with everything you need, the staff goes above and beyond the most demanding expectations. Breakfast buffet is a must with it's homemade yogurt with real vanilla. The pool area is nice, comfortable with a good food and drink menu. Valet is fast and efficient. One of the best hotel we've stay anywhere in the world. On a 4 night stay we were asked 4 times by the hotel manager how was our stay... 5 star guest service

Reviews.Title: “1 word........ Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: MohammedUAE
Reviews.Content: I thought I paid for quality it turns out I paid for something which isn't worth spending money on. Staff were pretentious they were fake, room was dark and gloomy, food at room service was seriously horrible crap menu. Never have I experienced a hotel which hires old people for room service especially in Beverly hills....the only good staff are the valet people they were genuine. I'd stay at other hotels rather than the dark gloomy miserable SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip to LA. Rooms are nice but dark. Wouldn't be ideal if I needed to work in room for very long. Pool area was nice but cramped. The breakfast was great, especially if you're looking for healthy options. The service was very good, but I'm still trying to work through a problem in my bill that occured at check-out. Finally got the billing straight after several phone calls; still trying to get my Starwood credit. Front desk is pretty responsive, but still a bit frustrating for a "luxury class" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and chic but dark!”
Reviews.Author: SMVC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were helpful but the rooms had really bad lighting, even in the bathrooms. Hotel decor was ultra modern, slick and stylish but, i wouldn't eat in their lobby bar area, but definitley worth visitng the bar and The Bazaar next door, amazing! the other thing to be aware of was that there were pet dogs in the hotel whcih we did hear walking back to our room on occasion. The complimentary town car was great for getting to rodeo if you needed it. Location wise it wasn't next to anything so we tended to walk or get taxis everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A chic, modern, minimalist hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: The_Global_Citizen
Reviews.Content: Our family (3 kids 16,14 & 9) had a fantastic 5 night stay at SLS Beverly Hills. The location is great and the quality and the service lived up to the reputation and our expectations. The staff were generally very professional and courteous. The bedrooms are great and quite spacious but are a bit dark (part of the design) and the bathroom takes a bit of getting used to. The pool deck was often very busy and the price of snack food is expensive (even by Beverly Hills standards) but it's a great facility and every visitor should try to get up there at least once! All in all a great experience and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Luxury Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Lauren
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early June when I went to LA for business and attended the MTV Movie Awards. This was exactly as billed: a luxury high end hotel set in the LA nightlife scene. This is not a family hotel --- but does anyone expect it to be? By day, guests are spotted enjoying bloody mary's by the pool and, by night, cocktails in downstairs lobby. The room was comfortable and modern. Room service was prompt. Restaurants and bars were pricey but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at Pearl Recovery Retreat at SLS”
Reviews.Author: JFrank010
Reviews.Content: Was recovering after surgery for 4 days at Pearl Recovery Retreat at SLS Hotel. Had excellent private room with very caring and knowledgeable nurses that made my stay very pleasant and recovery easy. Five plus star service, food and care. John

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagobeenz
Reviews.Content: My stay @ the SLS was great! The front desk staff was very professional and personable; and the restaurant service was A+. The only downside I had was that, I used my points to pay for my incidentals, but they charged me on my card also. I have yet to see the credit on my bill, but I understand mistakes happen. The rooms are nice - I had a work-out facility in it and also an outdoor patio, which I didn't get a chance to enjoy. All in all, it was a pleasant stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: familytravel75
Reviews.Content: My family and I checked into this hotel after a 2 night stay in Disneyland. My daughter got car sick on the way, and the hotel was very nice in sending up milk and cookies to the room as soon as we checked in. We have stayed at some of the nices hotels in Beverly Hills and wanted to try out the SLS. They did not let us down. They checked us in and upgraded us to a nicer room. The Concierge and front desk staff were excellent with directions and suggestions. The location was amazing. You are a few minutes from Santa Monice, Rodeo Drive, The Grove, and walking distance to the Beverly Center. The rooms are very nice, and the bed were extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are very modern, and the shower experience is unique. My daughters took 2 baths and showers a day just to have fun in there. I had a massage in the spa, and thought it was very nice. It was private, and plush. The spa staff were very accomodating. Would definitely reccomend using their services. The hotel restaraunt, Bazaar, was very good. It is one of the highest rated in the area. There is a long wait to get reservations, but if you are staying in the hotel, they get you in immediately. You must experience this place. The food was great, and the decor is one of a kind. You don't want to miss it. The pool is on the roof and very nice. There are cabanas to use, and the wait staff were very attentive. I will be staying at the SLS everytime I come to Beverly Hills from now on. You really can't beat what you get and how you are treated.

Reviews.Title: “A W for grown-ups”
Reviews.Author: wizzy99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (late 30's) had two one-night stays a few weeks ago, and got to experience two different rooms with outdoor space. Our first, 714, was a suite with a small terrace. The terrace was basically unusable; no furniture; I'm guessing it was designed as a place for people to smoke. On our second stay, we had a standard room with a terrace (486). It had two good-sized chairs and a view of a private courtyard, below the pool (but not visible from the pool level). Service was very good throughout, although I had issues getting my Starwood platinum amenity (fruit plate) during the first stay. It never did show up after multiple requests, so I switched back to standard points. We really enjoyed dinner at Bazaar on our second stay; it was great having good food without having to get in the car (although I did find it odd we had to exit the hotel to enter the restaurant - would be nice to have a side door for guests).

Reviews.Title: “Sublime Luxurious Style ...”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: This is not a run of the mill hotel. If you expect and/or need predictability, then you won't get it! A true concept hotel with beautiful Phillipe Stark design and genuinely attentive and caring service that will make you feel part of the SLS family. My mother and I were at the end of a 7 week world trip and this was exactly what we needed. Beautiful property and aesthetics made our stay a true pleasure. Nitpickers will say it's too dark and some of the furniture may have seen better days but again, perhaps they should stay at the Sheraton... A lovely and enriching experience with excellent staff and a bright and soothing philosophy. Only regret? I had no time to spend at the beautiful pool! I would love to stay there again! Thank you SLS!!! xxx

Reviews.Title: “A hip hotel in LA.....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Loved the experience. We stayed at the SLS suite which was about 800 sqf. Nice layout and unique decor. Excellent service all over. However, the biggest downfall was too limited lighting in most of the places including lobby & rooms. But I heard from one of the staff that their management was working on that to improve the lighting system specially in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: dont believe any negative reviews, this is the best hotel in LA by a long way. i have been coming here for 15 years and its awesome. great rooms, great food, great postion. the pool is awesome...great people watching,,,,what a team led by Suchi.......i had a great time added with unbelievale service. IT IS THE BEST HOTEL IN LA, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Stylish and very LA!”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of luxury hotels, and the SLS lived up to my expectations. The hotel is kitted out with the kitsch and the cool - from a bath that fills from the ceiling in your bathroom, to the giant frames around the swimming pool. The on-site food is delicious, if not a little pricey. If you can bare to walk a few blocks though (LA is not made for pedestrians), there's plenty of shops and diners. The rooftop pool is really lovely, and has sweeping views of LA and some of the best pieces of furniture I've ever seen. The staff are friendly and charming, and made us feel very welcomed.The bar next door is not to be missed - the candy-floss cocktail and nitrous oxide cocktails are an experience in themselves and must be tried! The hotel is truly stunning, highly stylish and a really cool place to stay. You can walk to Robertson, which has some cool shops and eateries. The area however is a little soul-less though. Finally, as a 'pet friendly' hotel, you can bring your feline friends, however please don't let them bark all night, which my neighbours did and woke me several times :( WIFi is available, but sadly not free - a bit of an oversight by the hotel. In summary, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Beverley Hills, it is stylish, cool and surprisingly chilled out.

Reviews.Title: “Very LA - great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Esm35
Reviews.Content: Loved the SLS! Would definitely stay again. Very unique hotel - non traditional and very cool. Ciel spa is amazing - had incredible massage/facial/hair/makeup services. The bazaar restaurant in the hotel is also unreal. Best meal I have ever had. be sure to try the Philly cheesesteak and the picadillo pepper dishes! Loved loved loved this hotel! We stayed in a signature suite - great layout, lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “A++ Service - a sin to not stay here while in LA”
Reviews.Author: Cliff2fs
Reviews.Content: I travel a ton for business and always stay here whenever work brings me to LA. Beyond business travelers, the hotel has an eclectic mix of friendly guests that always make for a fun experience. There's even an occasional celebrity sighting! Unlike many of the stuffy, pretentious trendy hotels in the area -- all people (even the "un-cool, hehe) will feel welcome here. SPG members note: you're especially valued here -- I've been able to receive an upgrade every time I stay. By far the most impressive Starwood property in the US. The ONLY downside of this place is the house car-- it's huge, indiscreet tricked out Mercedes Benz shuttle van. A simple sedan would be much more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “This is hotel is ghetto chic.”
Reviews.Author: Sas0920
Reviews.Content: So I am here during memorial day weekend. The hotel is not in the heart of Beverly hills it's about a 10 minute cab ride from that area. Not thrilled about that. The pool area service sucks and the pool itself it not that great. Not as pictured. The original adjoining room arrangements were not met. They couldn't even put us on the same floor after all. The restaurants in hotel are just average. The room itself is ok girls no good lighting for makeup smokey mirrors cover the room very dark feeling. Linens are just basic not as plush as I had hoped. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “non existent service”
Reviews.Author: Missyjkitten
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a night in May , a stopover in LA before flying off to Cancun. I guess they decided that since we were only staying for one night we should be put in the worst room possible. The room we were given was the furthest away from the lift. We had to practically walk around in circles until we actually got there. Then at the pool, it was impossible to get ANY kind of service. We asked for towels at least 3 times. I think he only brought it to us because I said that I would just get it myself if he told me where they were. Also almost impossible was ordering drinks and then when he came by he said to my boyfriend and I "what would you ladies like?" My boyfriend does not look like a lady. Anyway considering that we paid over $350 for our accommodation, I do not think that what we received was value for money. The rooms are small, service is very average or non existent (at the pool). I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “superlative!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelpresse
Reviews.Content: the SLS is one of the slickest hotels I've ever stayed at. great service, great food, great scene. the rooms are large and super modern. perfect location as well!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Trip in LA - Beverly Hills Style”
Reviews.Author: kaisoap
Reviews.Content: SLS Hotel is fantastic! If you are looking for the ultimate LA experience, this hotel makes you feel like a celebrity. The hotel is uber modern, but not the cold starck kind of modern. The attention to luxury and detail makes this stay an unforgettable experience. Aaron Gonzales contacted us before our arrival to let us know about the fantastic spa and amenities at the hotel. His personal touch to our stay made us feel very welcomed at the hotel. We arrived on a Friday evening, the hotel was buzzing with activity and people. We checked in with Francesca at the front desk, she was very warm and friendly and really means it when she says 'let me know if there is anything I can do to make your stay more comfortable'. The hotel room was huge, sectional couch, seating area, huge bathroom etc. Very comfortable. The hotel staff is very accomadating and helpful, you can tell that they truly believe is quality, service and luxury. Highlights of Hotel - Great lobby - Great rooms - Full size bath luxury products (face wash, body wash, shampoo etc) - Great sheets - Television in Mirror - Service - Huge bathrroms - Location The hotel location is ideal for foodies and shoppers, right next to Matsuhisa (Nobu's resturaunt), Melrose and Beverly Shopping center. Please stay here if you are visiting LA, if not, you are missing out.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top places to stay in LA.”
Reviews.Author: tpaladino77
Reviews.Content: The SLS is my home away from home in Los Angeles. I've been here dozens of times, and I'm never disappointed. The rooms are fantastic... well decorated and beautifully furnished. The bathrooms are absolutely spectacular as well. If I had to pick one thing to complain about, it would be that I wish they had slightly higher ceilings. But other than that minor issue, I have nothing bad to say. Do get a suite though if you want a bit of space for yourself or if you're planning on entertaining guests. The standard rooms are not very large. The food is amazing as well... both at Tres and Bazar. Although they're both amazing, for a truly transcendent culinary experience, you can't do much better than Bazar. It's definitely top-ten in LA as far as I'm concerned. The pool is pretty much everything you'd expect a rooftop LA hotel pool to be; glamorous, exclusive, expensive, and populated with scantily clad beautiful people and more than a few celebrities. The staff will literally bend over backwards for you as well, which is always a plus. Yes, it's a pricey experience. But considering what else is out there (and the prices), you're getting your money's worth. While this is not THE most spectacular hotel in the entire world, it is definitely a quintessential LA destination, and one where you're guaranteed to feel like a movie star.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ktothej4
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the SLS this past weekend for her birthday and we both could not say enough wonderful things about the hotel. From the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out, the service was wonderful. Our room was very modern and comfortable with all of the necessary amenities, the pool was relaxing (despite some of the other rude guests speaking inappropriately and loudly on their cell phones!), and the dinner at Bazaar was just phenomenal. The hotel itself is very chic, we will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful & Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Madrid008
Reviews.Content: My stay at the SLS was simply delightful. Surrounded by attention to detail, beauty and comfort I felt right at home, quickly understanding that the luxury of details were there for the right reasons. This is not a cool, snob-silly hotel. This is a warm and friendly place with design and luxury that reaches for the stars to please. Staff are genuine and helpful and kind--clearly empowered to be the best they can be. The food is also extraordinary, of course. Delightful & extraordinary experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy, Good Value, a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: AlbertR
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the SLS Beverly Hills while on vacation in LA. The Hotel is very trendy, a "see and be seen" scene. The restaurant / bar "Bazaar" located at the hotel seems to attract a very trendy crowd, and offers great food as well! We ate there one night, and I found it very interesting. We booked a corner suite with a balcony (only 3 available), as the hotel is non-smoking, and we wanted to smoke in the balcony. The room was quite large, with a lot of empty space (which I understand is a "design" issue, but personally I would have liked a couch in the vast area between the bed and the TV). Nice amenities, very nice design, very trendy and hip. Free wi-fi was in the rate. The common areas are also very nice, especially the lobby area. The "guests only" pool area on the 6th floor is also nice, but the pool is quite small. The location is quite good as well, as it's walking distance from the Beverly Center mall, and a good epicenter from which to start a drive around the city. Issues: * Nice to have a Mac in the room, but we could not get it to connect to the Internet, so it was pretty useless. * Upon arrival my girlfriend opened a candy bar and a bottle of water. Later, I realized that they charge $6 for the candy bar and $10 for a bottle of Evian. That's too much. No reason for that. * The door to the shower slams closed every time, and that caused all the items on the shelve inside to fall on the floor every time. * There is a showerhead on the wall in the shower that is basically immovable, and no other options. That means that when you turn the shower on, you will immediately get splashed with cold water. No matter what you do, you cannot avoid this! * $36 / day for valet parking is too high for guests. * The sliding door to the balcony was faulty, and you had to use all your strength to open and close it. Overall, a nice place, but I am not sure I would return. I got a great rate (3+1 free night) from Starwood, so overall a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and hip modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Therese_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed staying at the SLS. The prices were a bit steep in the bar and restaurant, but the hotel itself was beautiful. I very much liked the rooftop pool area.
