That was funky. The design of the room was very chic and modern. Definitely one of the nicer rooms I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Chic Hotel; Great Restaurant (Bazaar) but Awful Service = We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: NYCouple7
Reviews.Content: As frequent business and personal travelers, my wife and I stay a lot of top tier hotels. So for the start of our honeymoon on our way to Tahiti from NY we decided to stay at the SLS for a few days. The only thing top tier about the SLS was the restaurant Bazaar (highly recommend). As for the hotel itself, the design is unique, modern, very cool and inviting; as for the service --- not so much. In this day and age where customer service is paramount the SLS completely failed in my book for a few reasons: 1. I had a confirmed upgrade through American Express and when I arrived the person checking me in told me that I had been upgraded but when I got to my room, I realized this was the room I paid for. When the hotel admitted it was wrong, they told us we could move rooms (we were already unpacked) or they would refund us the difference. We chose the refund, but when we checked out they had no recollection of that conversation and it was a hassle to get resolved. 2. A friend of mine had sent us a bottle of champagne as gift but I didn't find out until he called me and asked why i didn't call him and say thank you. Maybe it's because the hotel never sent it, although they told him otherwise. 3. The hotel has a nice car service that will take guests anywhere in a 2.0 mile radius. My wife and I had reservations at a restaurant that was 2.2 miles from the hotel and the concierge told my wife it wasn't possible to use the car. I politely reminded the concierge that it was our honeymoon and he begrudgingly allowed us to use the car but it had to be on his time line. Overall, while the aesthetic of the hotel is great, it felt like the staff was doing me a favor in allowing me and my wife to stay at the hotel. Thanks for the favor - I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “SLS GREAT PLACE FOR A GETAWAY.”
Reviews.Author: souray44
Reviews.Content: Surprised my wife with a trip to L.A. for a milestone birthday and thought i would splurge on a really swank five star. Swank it was, very trendy,upscale and service that was never ending. It didnt matter which employee you came across they were all very friendly and always willing to help. The valet staff were always very helpful as were the concierge staff. The rooftop pool is a great way to unwind and have a nice drink in the California sunshine. The rooms are very modern and are not your typical hotel room. If you are looking for dinner plans we would strongly recommend the Gordon Ramsay at the London Hotel. What an amazing dining experience, the food and service were out of this world. When we go back to L.A. in december we will be dining here again for sure. The only negative was the hotel does not provide free wifi for its guests, when your paying that much to stay somewhere it should be included. Overall a really great hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thanks SLS for making this a great trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but disconnected.”
Reviews.Author: Jmarino12
Reviews.Content: Great staff, spa was small, but nice. Non suites are not too big. Little light makes it hard to get dressed. Cool bathrooms. Very open. Lobby was dark and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, incredible food, and very stylish decor!”
Reviews.Author: RobertaAngelica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the SLS Hotel on April 8th, after a few days in Las Vegas. We were informed that our suite was not available, because the previous guests had not checked out on time, and it would be approximately a 2 to 3 hour wait, unless we wished to down grade to a smaller room, with only a queen size bed. As upsetting as this was, one look around at this gorgeous hotel made it hard to be angry. The lounge is so comfortable, with beautiful fireplaces, and nice lighting. We were seated by a super sweet young lady, Ingrid, and then we met Elmer. Elmer is so nice, recommended the best pastrami sandwich my husband and I have ever had in our life, and introduced us to our new favourite wine, Michaud ... Elmer is amazing. Then we met Autumn, the Outlets Manager, I have never met a more genuine, kind, and super helpful person, at any hotel, and I travel a lot. Autumn told me were to find anything and everything, I needed to make our trip perfect. We shared my husbands B day cake with everyone, that is how great the staff at the SLS is! We finally got to our suite, and Andrea was kind enough to offer us champagne, or wine to make up for the long wait ... The room was lovely, but my husband and I were not to happy with the lack of bathroom privacy, the sliding mirrors on either side of the toilet and sink, makes it feel as if the bathroom is in the middle of the living room and bedroom. Also I had requested a suite with a bathtub, the one we had reserved originally and never got, and even offered to pay more, we were told we could upgrade to what we originally reserved, on our second night, but never heard back after several requests ... Despite that, IT WAS GREAT! The breakfast and brunch are fantastic, Frank the driver, is great, and all the staff is just truly, the best. Thanks again to Elmer and Autumn, you are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Take themselves waaayyy too seriously”
Reviews.Author: trippin7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is best suited for uber-hipsters and/or people with noooooo regard for $50 breakfasts and mediocre pool-side salads for $45. The hotel's decor is quite brilliant, very unique and unique (did I already mention that?). But I felt the beauty was only skin-deep. A very puckered and strained front desk, who made you feel like they were doing you a favor to check you in. And if you have kids? You were sorta invisible. That set the pace for the entire visit. Rooms are modern and beautiful. Front desk notwithstanding, service was excellent at the lobby bar, as was breakfast service. But be forewarned, the prices for a cocktail and eggs over-easy are not for the faint of heart. In my opinion, you stay here to enjoy the outward beauty (although not for everyone) and the incredible interpretation of modern design. But beyond that, your date with the pretty girl gets boring (and expensive) quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Altitude66
Reviews.Content: Class A service in the heart of Beverly Hills. I only wished I had stayed longer. The room was spic and span. I love the elevators. Avery at the lobby bar was very friendly, but not in a chatty way. I definitely recommend this hotel, if you want to live the life.

Reviews.Title: “SLS crazy amazing hotel~!”
Reviews.Author: ace_boy36
Reviews.Content: Loved every second of my experience! From the warm welcome from the valet, to my comp champagne being delivered to my room cause of the special guest they knew I had! Every need was more than met! My sleep was amazing also, couldn't believe i was in the middle of the city. Couldn't hear not one car! VERY satisfied. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “They Forgot About Luxury When Trying To Be Cool”
Reviews.Author: tlj85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the SLS this weekend for a nice long weekend in LA. I was looking forward to the edgy style and a little bit of uber luxury after staying in standard W and JW properties every week for my job. Unfortunately, this hotel was a huge disappointment. For a luxury hotel, the service was terrible. When we arrived, we dropped our car off with the valet. No one offered to take our bags and there wasn’t anyone who pointed us in the right direction when we started walking away from the entrance to the hotel. Throughout our stay, no one asked us how our was stay was going or even greeted us as we walked through the lobby every day. When we did have to interact with the front desk staff to call security to check on a lost item, they just dialed a phone and said, “you can speak with them directly.” In short, the staff was very aloof and provided service I would expect at a motel 6, not a luxury Beverly Hills hotel. When it came to the décor, it was more tacky than cool. The room had mirrors on every wall and the bathroom had mirrors on every surface. The chairs were hard and uncomfortable and the bed was not what I would call luxurious. I understand that they were going for edgy style, but that doesn’t mean I am willing to give up comfort. If you are looking to get your fill of tacky décor, I would recommend just hitting up the restaurant. Otherwise, avoid this hotel with its uncomfortable rooms and terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic DecorState of the art Hotel Cool !”
Reviews.Author: SHE81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 nights . Very accomodating when I checked in they let me get my room early or I had the option to wait for a room w/ a terrace. I chose the 1st option amd it was fine. The decor is really cool . The elevators are cool. A very interesting Hotel tobe in. I thought the room was a bit tooo dark for my taste but that goes w/ the decor style. Very comfortable bed and I slept well. Free Coffe in the lobby in the AM...I loved that! Location is not in the heart of Beverly Hills but that didnt bother me since I rented a car. The gym was very nice and had good equipment. The rooftop pool is nice but the food there was nothing delicious...just alright. Service is pretty Ok and the staff is out to please I thought its nerve to charge 30.00 for daily parking especially when my daily renttal car costs less but I guess thats the rate they can get away with I would most definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Kool Hip Hotel W/ great Service”
Reviews.Author: bmwminirc10
Reviews.Content: To my surprise this hotel was very nice..Will plan my next business trip in this hotel.Beds comfortable pillows great bathroom is gorgeous.The spa was also very refreshing See you guys again shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Probably try somewhere else the next time”
Reviews.Author: loopies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a terrace room on the 2nd floor. Loved eating breakfast on our terrace each morning. When we booked through spg we paid about $15-20 extra/night to get free wi-fi and bottled water in the room. However after check in we realized there was no bottled water or information about free wifi in the room. At the front desk they didn't have record of this on our reservation and had never heard about that type of offer but offered to send up bottled water for us - which arrived when we were out at a cost of $15.80. We called down, they said it would be removed from the bill but on check out it was not. We also had to sign in to pay $12.95 daily for internet which did not appear on the final bill - a strange way to offer free wi-fi. Overall the hotel was nice but, the lobby was too dark - perhaps part of the hollywood anonymity vibe? No matter what we did in the room, despite all the mirrors, the lighting was horrible and it was hard to see. But the biggest problem of all was dirty sheets on the bed. Shortly after arriving I noticed brown stains on the bed (kind of like splattered coffee or something like that). I called down and they came to change the sheets while we were out. 2 days later I noticed more of the same kind of stains on the sheets (not the same sheet because it was in different places) as well as a blood stain on a pillow case. I called down to complain and did receive a $60 breakfast credit for the next morning and the sheets were changed again. I probably wouldn't go back, but it was an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Sleeping!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_buc
Reviews.Content: My 2nd year staying at the SLS. All I can say is "BEST HOTEL EVER". I cannot rave enough about the SLS Hotel. I don't know any other hotel that can meet their standards. From the Valet Service to Check-In to Room Service to Housekeeping to Concierge to Dining/Bar to Guest Svcs, EVERY service is at the highest of standards and the quality of service could not get any better. With all the celebrities that stay at this hotel, I have to say that EVERYONE is treated the SAME! We were treated with the utmost respect and we were made to feel extremely special. The Staff is very professional and extremely nice and pleasant and alway willing to assist you in any way. I will only stay at the SLS when visting the LA area and will only stay at Starwood Hotels when traveling. I just wish there was a SLS Hotel here in NorthernCA(hint...hint...) Superb Luxury Sleeping......SLS.......The BEST!!!! Thanks SLS Lisa Chavis

Reviews.Title: “Non-responsive hotel reservations - Wheres the customer service?”
Reviews.Author: Terps37
Reviews.Content: Prior to my reservations, I sent two emails to the reservation email address listed on the SLS website. My initial email to inquire about a room supplemental and follow-up email were ignored. The room supplemental request (pay to upgrade) was a key component is our decision whether to stay at the SLS since we were traveling with a toddler. Having stayed at Starwood properties worldwide, this is my first experience running into a complete lack of customer service. Without any response from the front desk, we canceled this reservation and made alternative arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for Dinner, Avoid for all other purposes”
Reviews.Author: nickijags
Reviews.Content: I stay in LA about once a month on business. I have probably stayed in over 20 hotels in LA. This trip was over a weekend and the BF and I decided to make it a little vacation.Santa Monica is my preference (Shutters, Le Merigot) and in West Hollywood, we prefer The London. SLS is a Starwood and I have stayed in my share of W Hotels- from Chicago to Istanbul- so I am familar with the "cool" attitude at these properties. SLS sounded like an upbeat, fun choice in Beverly Hills. The restaurant garners great reviews (and deservedly) but the hotel was a disaster from the minute we arrived. Our room was on the 2nd floor and even with every light on, it was dark. There were not any drawers to put clothes. There wasn't even a luggage stand. Our bags had to stay out for the entire 5 days. In the middle of the mirrored room. I switched to a room on the 4th floor in hopes of getting a bit more light. The maintenance team eventually had to bring me lamps. The bathroom is black -and more dark! There is a bizarre window that opens so you can watch the TV/bed and brush your teeth. This wasn't cool- it was stupid. But you had to keep it open to get light. Putting on makeup was a total disaster. The makeup mirror gave us minimal light as well. Ironing board was a mini one and since there wasn't any where to put it, the BF ironed his shirts while kneeling on the floor. The room was useless and not at all comfortable. It was hard to organize stuff, and felt cluttered and messy at all times. On the first morning, we forgot to hit the "make up room" switch (yes, switch) next to the door and were treated to an unmade room at 5pm. Service was abominable. The concierge was downright rude. When I asked for an umbrella (our room was mysteriously missing it!) she told me they were all out and I had to wait. Indefinitely. It was pouring rain. When I asked for a car service to take me to a drugstore she told me it was already gone and I could wait. Indefinitely. Or have the hotel run errands for me at a $20 service fee. I complained to the manager and was given an umbrella immediately. I will never stay at the SLS again. Nothing was pleasant about this experience- except when we got to check out. LA is full of hip, comfortable hotels. This is NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings- trendy and cool but misses b/c of weak service with attitude”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: I originally chose to stay here b/c it is a Starwood hotel and I have a lot of points. It's their LA luxury property. I wouldn't call it luxury, it's more trendy/ sceney. They really miss on service. The place is really very stylish but the staff are a nightmare. We came back to the hotel with colleagues after an evening out. I have stayed here once a month( usually 3-5 nights) for the past year. I feel like staff should know me but they don't, just not the kind of place that seems to bother or perhaps too much turnover? We tried to have tea/drinks in the quieter part of the lobby. They told us to go to the other lobby. They could not serve since they were setting up for breakfast. We were told to get up and move to another area 3 times until finally I mentioned that I had stayed in the hotel a dozen times and that they were being totally inhospitable. It was frankly sort of embarrassing. A manager would tell us we could sit in one place and then another or a server would say we could not. As hotel guests we were told that the desert tables were reserved for diners from the restaurant as part of the " experience" . I have eaten in the restaurant and was never made aware of " the experience". It sounded ridiculous. We were trying to have a couple of cocktails, maybe some appetizers and tea at 11:00 on a Friday night. Trying to cop a NY attitude in LA just doesn't work for me...especially when I am a hotel guest not a clubber...so annoying. It just feels very bar like...so if you are going for that you might enjoy it. Room service portions are very small. Decor is fun and original as are slogans around the hotel. In the future I will opt for other nearby, less trendy/ more service oriented establishments. I just don't have patience for this kind of BS. I didn't even have the patience to tell the management that the left hand had no idea what the right hand was doing 4x within15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bean820
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the SLS Hotel 5+ times for business trips. I love their location in LA, very central to all the areas one needs to get too. The hotel itself is very trendy- so if thats not your thing- this place isn't for you. Its edgy and modern and quirky, and the theme is consistent throughout the hotel. The room is too dark for me personally, including the bathroom. I wish there was a little more light, but I know thats also the vibe they're going for. The beds however are large and comfy. All the rooms I've stayed in have just had a shower, not bath tub. The restaurant Bazaar is definitely worth a trip. Its located on the main level, and serves up great small plates and cocktails. This part of the hotel becomes quite the scene at night time. The rooftop pool is great when its not crowded. When its crowded, its a bit much. The spa is great, and the gym is adequate. The menus can be a bit particular/bizarre themselves for room service, but I've learned you can usually ask them for something more simple and they'll provide. Overall, great service, great location, and a fun property. If you like more traditional, not for you.

Reviews.Title: “The worst "luxury" hotel you could possibly find”
Reviews.Author: jgilbey
Reviews.Content: This hotel borders on a joke, culminating in what the manager finally said to me that was pure comedy gold. More of that in a minute. The put me in the wrong room, the mini bar was stocked with a three day mouldy sausage (honest), in room dining took 90 minutes and apologized there were only two shrimp on a shrimp salad. Two days and 15 calls later they finally returned my shoes (it must have been a good clean) and they'll never replace anything you use. When frustration got the better of me and I summoned the manager and asked him to promise that nothing else would go wrong he said he couldn't but if it was the Four Seasons, he could. Neither me nor anyone from the company I work for will stay here again. I deeply urge you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with amazing food and a great concierge. The perfect LA hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwilark
Reviews.Content: Amazig food and dining. Great rooms. Even better service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jbsun4442
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really incredible. Had a wonderful time, the sls is very hollywood hotel!! love it, great service, love the pool area..just fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique design, wonderful service, fun vibe, amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MEMSPhD
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the SLS in as many months. As someone who is interested in design and fashion, I appreciate the unique style of the hotel. It's a feast for the eyes and the rooms are really beautiful and sexy. The restaurant and bar at the Bazaar cannnot be missed and the concierge was great about getting me in even though I didn't plan ahead enough to make a reservation (and it was packed, of course). Definitely a place to see / be seen. Service is everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel and more! I was contacted before my stay and the concierge made sure I had the perfect room. Candy from the in-hotel dessert kitchen was waiting in my room. They were always friendly and happy to tell me about the area. I didn't have any problems but I'm sure they would have taken care of them immediately. Hope to stay here again soon, would be fun for romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Lux”
Reviews.Author: spikesmumSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really incredible. I've stayed at 5 star resorts all over the world and the SLS Beverly Hills rates right up there with them and then some. It's just so unique in every detail from the vibe to the decor to the amenities and especially The Bazaar which is hands down one of the best restaurants I've dined in. Everything about the SLS Beverly Hills is well thought out, the vision is very clear. I have to say the thing that impressed me the most was the email I got from guest relations before I arrived. It was a special weekend for me and my boyfriend and Aaron had champagne delivered to our room! He also followed up with me several times during our stay to make sure everything was going well. We had an amazing dinner Friday evening and got our butts kicked by Agostina's bootcamp on Saturday. The gym is not to be missed and you definately have to check out the pool. Who needs Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Happenin'”
Reviews.Author: OC_M_Lu
Reviews.Content: SLS is very Hollywood. Our valet guy looks so hot that you'd think he's just waiting to be discovered by an agent. The patio furniture and decoration is very welcoming and is the best spot to people-watch. Entering the check in area is much like entering a club- with dim lights, red carpet, nice floral arrangements. Check in was efficient and we were led instantly to the elevators which had really interesting and fun portraits. The room is spacious and the best part I think is the soft comfortable King bed in the middle of the room. The bathroom is a good size but I'm slighty disappointed that it doesnt have a tub. They are generous with the toiletries, not the Vegas travel size shampoos in this hotel. The location is not the Beverly Hills that you see in the movies. It is not walking distance to Rodeo Drive nor the Beverly Center. Also- parking is $35 a day! There are high end restaurants that are walking distance to the hotel. We had dinner on the first floor-Tres. The menu is limited and service is slow. We waited at least 20 minutes between the soup and the main dish. The pool is on the top floor and has a fun vibe- again, very Hollywood. You see botoxed faces drinking their little martinis. When we checked out, we saw the actor Aaron Eckhart enter. What a bonus! It was a good experience for us but we're not really inclined to come back again. I think the rate ($320/night) is high than what it actaully offers.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel delivers quality and excitement without being overstated”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fabulous stay at the SLS. The service was very attentive and prompt, without being over-bearing. The look of the hotel is very modern and hip, but again, not overdone. Our room was terrific, very spacious with huge bathroom and very comfortable bed. Stayed with Amex platinum and received room upgrade, free breakfast and $100 credit toward food/bev. The spa was sensational, excellent tub soak and couples massage. Avoid the version of this package where they give you a candle. Turns out to be a $60 candle. Went to the pool for while. Cool set up on the roof. The day turned out to be busier than the hotel might have expected, I think. This was the one part of the stay that was only good. Still it was good. Had dinner at Bazaar. This restaurant is not to be missed. The creative cuisine, the service and the wild cocktails made every moment memorable. The hotel goes out of it's way to follow up before and after your stay to ensure that everything was tremendous and does a nice job of it. Aaron Gonzales was particularly helpful for me.

Reviews.Title: “LA Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: NYCAndrew82
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum with 42 stays last year, I can confidently say I've been all over the country with Starwood Preferred Guest. No hotel goes out of its way for Platinum Guests like the SLS in Beverly Hills. From consistent no hassle upgrades to pre-arrival emails to ensure things are just right to a VIP cabana at the rooftop pool equipped with complimentary drinks and water, the SLS knows how to treat frequent customers like they are true VIPs.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely Stay-SLS”
Reviews.Author: dgcasting
Reviews.Content: The SLS is a cut above other high end hotels but it does so without having its nose up in the air like other 5 star hotels are prone to do. The SLS is contemporary, stylish...hot! but its staffed with people who truly care about your stay. It's the Staff that makes the difference. This was our 2nd stay at the SLS and there will be more. Note to those traveling with families; the SLS is not really for kids. They would have more fun elsewhere. But you and your spouse on your own? now you are talking!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pool, big rooms and gadgets but overall just ok”
Reviews.Author: DebCC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few stop over days. Good walking access to shops and restaurants. Pool deck quirky but fun for the kids. Rooms full of gadgets, TVs, fun fittings and well sized. Overall cleanliness is average. Leather couches are in need of a good clean. The rooms lighting is terrible - you dress in the dark and really struggle to put on make up. Better in house dining at other LA hotels in the area. You have to like very modern and not want any of the plush hotel experience. So much for the gadgets - you have to pay for Internet!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanner88
Reviews.Content: I thought that I would spoil myself for my birthday and it was worth every penny! The interior of the hotel is amazing and the service is fantastic. The concierge, Casey, deserves particular mention - he went out of his way to make the stay one to remember! A few bits of advice... Book a table at Bazaar for dinner when you check in. It's super busy and all those damn celebs make it tough to get a table late in the day. Breakfast at the hotel (Tres) is spectacular but a little overpriced. Eggs should be included in the buffet. They can't make a latte to save themselves but their granola and yoghurt was incredible. Service was A+. Overall this was a fantastic stay and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “The SLS is experience is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jwpatton385
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the SLS in April of last year (2010) it was an experience that I have to say I will never forget. I stayed with a few friends for a night for my birthday. The staff was very kind and warming. The ambiance was amazing. We stayed in one of the suites which was very roomy and sexy. Aaron Gonzales was the person who helped us with our accommodations. He was very nice, full of energy and all smiles. He took us out to the pool which I have to say is one of the better pools in LA and also walked us over to Bizarre which was a very funky/beautiful restaurant. I am a big fan of most of SBEs venues and if I need to stay in the West LA area again, I will strongly consider the SLS hotel for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateCinci
Reviews.Content: Great location in Beverly Hills. The hotel is hip - very fun decor and comfy/modern rooms. Bonus - the restaurant in the hotel called Bazaar is one of my all time favorites!

Reviews.Title: “In for something new and exciting? Try this one!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: SLS Hotel, Beverly Hills, Los Angeles. This is a surprise. Opened in late 2008, this is not your ordinary business hotel. I usually stayed in the Four Seasons Hotel at Beverly Hills, as this hotel has served me very well over the years, until I stayed in September 2009 in a room that was so worn down, so in need of renovation (which was done, I believe in early 2010) that I decided to try a new hotel. Ended up here in this hotel. The room I stayed in on the 7th floor (suite) was spacious and very attractively designed in the style of the hotel design by Philippe Stark. Initially it reminded me of the Royalton Hotel in New York where I stayed in the 1980s. You either like it or hate it. Fully agree with the hotel’s website that the hotel challenges traditional convention on luxury hospitality. The hotel houses a vibrant and very good restaurant (always full, make reservations!). As I cannot sleep when light comes in the room I asked –and got - a room with darkened curtains. Very sleek, exceptional, great hotel room. The bed was nice, service good and timely. A new star in Beverly Hills and certainly worth a try. My gut feel though is that you need to explore the rooms before making your choice which one to stay in. The one I choose was quietly located in a corner of the hotel on a high enough floor, spacious and relaxing. A very good choice if you are in for another-than-your –usual-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: jkuhl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with a friend for two nights in the end of december and could not have asked for anything more. The room was large,clean and well designed, the service was impeccable and the vibe was great! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: traceller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel twice over the course of a monbth and on both occasions I had a great stay.Friendly staff and try the restaurant and bar by Jose Andres.Great place, great Gin Tonics and an even greater crowd.I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service!”
Reviews.Author: teenytinytina
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, we did a one-night stay at the SLS in one of their lifestyle suites - their rooms with gym equipment. My boyfriend loved it! After I passed out from an amazing dinner at the Bazaar downstairs, he spent a couple of hours playing with the gym equipment. Aaron, a guest relations coordinator, contacted us prior to the trip to see if there's anything they could help rearrange for us. After a few email exchanges (amazingly fast responses), he set up our dinner reservation as well as a little treat for my boyfriend's birthday (chocolate covered strawberries + champagne). I would definitely stay here again for a fun night out! (Parking attendants were a little snooty though... we stood around for 3-4 minutes right in front of them before they acknowledged us.)

Reviews.Title: “service could not be beat”
Reviews.Author: ruthietee
Reviews.Content: i found the service at the SLS to be unbelievable... always willing to assist and provide advice, recommendations, etc. Waldo at the front desk was especially helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and impeccible standards; you must stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneSanDiegp
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more satisfied. Every member of the staff anticipated my needs and made certain that I enjoyed my weekend to the extent that I would return as soon as possible. Attention to detail and extra amenities.... I could not have asked for anything more. My 23 year old daughter was traveling with me and she was equally delighted by the service tha we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great Glitz, Lousy Managment”
Reviews.Author: real_in_philly
Reviews.Content: My family, 3 couples, stayed at the SLS while attending a family wedding in Los Angeles. I do not recommend the hotel. The hotel did not make up my room or my daughters. I arrived back at the hotel at midnignt after the wedding and ended up making up my own bed so my husband and I could go to sleep. I got lots of appologies from the front desk at midnight and the following morning when we checked out - but in all my travels (and I do alot of traveling) NO hotel has ever not made up my room before. It was not a mistake, they did not do my daughter's either. SImple unexplained incomptence. Checkout (we checked out at different times) took 20 minutes. The hotel had not deducted for a 20% spa credit, and meal/beverage coupons. The front desk could not look at the details of each transaction so they had to call the spa and restaurant for details for all the transactions. Because it could not be figured out expeditiously, the manager gave us an additional $50 off the bill. We accepted the rebate as close enough, after all we had a plane to catch. Structurally, the hotel is very avant-guarde. The bathrooms have two "barn" doors. They are not very soundproof and you heard much more bathroom noise in the bedroom than you should. In addition, We could easily hear the two children in the room next to ours. Parking was extremely expensive. and they charge for internet, Basically, I will not stay here again. This is not a first class experience. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bumpy Start - Smooth Finish”
Reviews.Author: VPVonHoehen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Starck designed chic Beverley Hills hotel that comes with all the bells and whistles including two of the best restaurants in the city (there is also an excellent third one) and and a great social environment complete with heaps of celebrities (if that is what you are into - I can't recognize even the ones whose names I do know). My initial impression of this hotel was of style over substance. In fact, one week into my five week stay, I was looking for other digs in the Hills where I was more certain that service standards would match my own standards. After a few serious conversations with management I was given a personal "handler" Henry Marquis, and he, along with Waldo Hernadez, the head concierge, and Autumn, the manager of Tres and the Altitude level, and many many other staff pulled together and not only convinced me to remain at the hotel the rest of my stay in Los Angeles but they managed to make me not regret it. Rooms are still a bit style over substance, especially for a long term guest, but overall this could be on its way to be a very smart, hip, hotel with great service (if they keep it up). I will be back in January so I will be able to say then if the service matches the claims of SBE's own PR spin.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and quality”
Reviews.Author: SPG666
Reviews.Content: The service, staff, and quality of the hotel was amazing. The rooftop pool is a must try with a great view of the hill. The only downside is location. If you are there for shopping, then you are at the right place. If you want touristy sight seeing, then you are 30-60 min away from the general touristy locations.

Reviews.Title: “SLS is Luxury with a sincere focus on comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: dalmy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at SLS since the opening in 2009 and I have never been disappointed. During my business stays, I have everything I need and my leisure stays feel like a true escape. While there have been a few mishaps during my stays, they have more than made up for any inconvenience I experienced. The best part of my SLS experience is the concierge service. Waldo, Casey, Fredo and team have it down and are by far the best at their craft. If I had to pick one thing they could enhance, the lighting in the bathrooms would be top of my list. Also, I have enjoyed many meals at the Bazaar and I have never had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “before you reach reception you know you are somewhere different..”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Passing through a small outdoor lounge with furniture made from, or heavily featuring, the horns of various animals and small tree branches you get to the lobby and you’re greeted by a life-size black horse with a lamp-shade on its head, accompanied by a pig balancing a fruit platter. You know you're in Philippe Starck-world. SLS Hotel scores a Hot Pink on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Hottest New Hotel in LA - Four Seasons quality with much hipper feel”
Reviews.Author: saulty1017
Reviews.Content: This is the best new hotel in LA. Very funky design in lobby and rooms, but all thoughtful and comfortable. The food at the restaurants is great - not your typical modern menu - its different and really tasty. Location in Beverly hills is excellent too. No reason to the Pennisula or four season - this is just as good, better rate and you will not feel like you are 65 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Competes with any 5 star hotel there is”
Reviews.Author: roryg13
Reviews.Content: Had such a great stay at the SLS. My room was not ready and i was in desperate need of some down time after a long day with a long night ahead and they upgraded me to a spectacular suite. the service was great and very friendly. i would highly recommend the hotel and look forward to SLS miami

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, just a few details”
Reviews.Author: charal95
Reviews.Content: Me and my two kids came for my son's birthday. I'm going to write the next review and my stay went. Check in/Check out So we arrived at this beautiful hotel through the Red Carpet. The check-in wan't what I was hopping. I had already paid my full stay through Expedia but they still needed a Credit Card which I don't have, last time at the Beverly Hilton they just ask me for a 200 usd deposit, but at first the guy just told us "This isn't how we do it here" a bit rude, but after checking with his manager we just put a deposit. The check out was very good and fast. Normally it's at 12:00 p.m. but they leave us check out until 1:00 p.m. without charges Because of the guy rudeness Im putting a 4.1 out of 5 Room The room was very nice with two double beds. The bathroom had a shower, which I thought it was a tub, and some great body lotions and shampoos. The t.v. is probably the coolest t.v. I've ever seen in a hotel, inside a furniture, WOW! There is also a desk with an internet cable (it should be already included!). What I really thought it was a bit dangerous it was the metals next to each bed and the lamp of the desk, my son hit himself twice!! I booked the room and the flight together but the room itself was about 230 usd per night, very good price and it was a Premiere room, which cost me 20 usd in total more and the only extra is that we were at the last floor and had two bottles of Evian. Before coming we asked for a nice view of the hills and 50% of our view was the Hospital, then a little bit some buildings and just a bit of the hills. The pool has better views and is on the 6th floor. I really liked the room I just thought the view could have been better. I give out a 4.6 out of 5 Restaurant We never had lunch/dinner at The Bazaar but it seemed cool. Anyways we had breakfast at the TRES, very expensive. Their eggs for adults are just greats but for kids are not. The food was good but seriously 8 usd for an orange juice? I know it's Beverly Hills but it just seems a lot. And then we had an issue the last morning with the waiter ALEX, he was asking something and I was translating it to my son, and because we didn't order he really got angry. The mexican waiter and the blond lady were just amazing in their work. Price, service and because of food I give a 4.4. Location I think this hotel has the best locationI've ever stayed at L.A. Last time I stayed at the Beverly hilton and the Beverly Wilshire both at Beverly Hills, but I'm not going to buy at Rodeo Drive so this hotel is just great. At the edge of Beverly Hills, is just 2 blocks away from the Beverly Center mall. There is a beautiful house car that it was always available so it can drive you to The Grove, Hollywood Blvd, Robertson, etc.. The best thing is that I didn't had car, (parking is 33 usd a night, EXPENSIVE!), and I spent less than 200 usd of taxi, including to the airport. The only bad thing is that is right to a hospital, so at least you will hear a lot of ambulances I give out a 4.9 Service Well apart from the Alex at the Tres and the check-in guy everything else was great. The housekeeping, the driver, the waiters, the concierge were very good. The concierge mad our stay. First we asked for a tour next day for the celeb house, but apparently he thought we didn't want it so he didn't booked it, but anyways Alex (Concierge) booked us for the best private tour of the Celebrity Houses, THE BEST TOUR I'VE EVER TAKEN. I will give out a 4.7 Amenities The hotel has a great pool at the 6th floor but because of the weather we didn't used but it was a really glamorous pool. I liked the House Car service, it saved us a lot of $$. There is also a business center, 6 usd for 15 minutes! and there is a Spa and a Fitness Center which looked fine. Apparently if you have a dog they will also give you an amenity kit. I give out a 4.7 Value/Price We booked the whole trip with Expedia and it was 2000 usd for 3 with airplane included from Mexico and 3 nights. So yes! it was less than 250 usd per night. I've seen reviews that said that it's the same price like the Four Seasons, but not for me. Something I really didn't liked was the over-priced breakfast. I give out 4.8 Overall. Great hotel, with bizarre decoration, I've never got to know what kind of decoration was, but still cool. It has an amazing pool and staff. The rooms are just very nice and the location is the best part. So the big question? Would I will stay here again? 90% yes, if I can find a low rate like this one, but I might try another hotel. I give out 5 points to this 4-diamond hotel in West Hollywood. I hope this review can help, wait for photos.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: WelcomeShawn12
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business. This last stay my wife was able to join me for a special occasion. I let the SLS hotel know that she would be coming. They made me wait 5 minutes extra and then up-graded me to a signature suite. 30 minutes later they arrived with champagne and strawberries (Complimentary). The experience made me look like a hero to my wife. I love the hotel and will stay there again every opportunity that I get. This place is amazing, service, food, staff, on and on and on!! Shawn

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious hotel with excellent attention to detail in making their guests stay wonderful”
Reviews.Author: moNYC30
Reviews.Content: My husband was on business and myself and two young girls were in LA for leisure- the hotel perfectly accommodated us both. This hotel you can tell takes pride in the details in making sure everyone has a great experience at their property. From the second we walked into the hotel the staff was warm, friendly and professional. All the staff we encountered kept making sure all our needs were met. The lobby of the hotel has a great vibe, the complimentary morning coffee was a great brew and the bar at Tres is a great place for happy hour and wee hours. The rooms were very well appointed- all the amenities were luxurious and the room itself was super spacious and the décor and design – practical and unique. I highly recommend spending time at the rooftop pool- with its breathtaking views of the city – it is a nice sanctuary and enjoyable place to catch a drink and relax. We travel to LA often and have stayed in many hotels in the Beverly Hills area- and this one has become our new favorite- we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best experiences I had”
Reviews.Author: Eatingouttoomuch
Reviews.Content: In my short time at the hotel I have found the employees particularly courteous and attentive. Everyone seems to go out of their way to accommodate the guests. I don't know many hotels worldwide that succeed in doing so. The SLS certainly does. I want to think that can be a judge as I travel to and stay at some of the best known hotels from Tokyo (Imperial Hotel) to the Rocco Forte Group (Villa Kennedy, Frankfurt) to many SPG properties (W Hotel Washington, DC). Congratulation on being one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Super”
Reviews.Author: amanwarren
Reviews.Content: Was a bit fearful when I drove up and saw taxi/limo congestion in the driveway and hordes of people milling about outside (an event had just ended, i think)....but once i figured out which was the entrance to the hotel and not the restaurant and bar, i entered a scene of high, yet warm, design, welcomed by a great check in desk guy, who told me I was getting upgraded, let me know without asking how to get logged on to the wireless, etc. My room was pretty amazing -- think updated Sanderson Hotel in London. Great large room, great bathroom and shower, lots of interesting touches throughout the room and hotel. SLS combines the frenzy of LA with the warmth of a first rate hotel -- not easy to do. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staffs were very snobby”
Reviews.Author: Justtrytorelax
Reviews.Content: I am a royal starwood customer. I have stayed at starwood properties over 130 days this year. So I have accumulate quiet a bit of points. I used my points to book one night at the SLS. When I arrived at SLS, the staff really made me feel like I don't belong there. Let's start with the front office staff. When I asked if there is an upgrade available, I quote," Oh I am sorry its not available, 65% of our guests tonight are platinum member booked with their points" followed by giggles from the rest of the front off staff. This was uncalled for in my opinion. He could just told me that it is not available and that would have been end of it. Any time I asked the front office staff for anything it was I am sorry we can't help you. This was extremely frustrating. Then the valet. We rented an infiniti G37 from hertz. when we picked up the car the valet boys were convinced that the car does not belong to us. He verified and re-verified our ticket. I thought that was a bit odd but it didn't bother me that much. They were trying to be responsible. Overall I feel like if you are not in your best dress clothe, don't bother coming to this hotel. But for the average frequent traveler, we don't travel with our LV and diamond. You are better off going to a W hotel across the street. Out of all the starwood/ hyatt/hilton hotels i have stayed at. SLS has the worst front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic”
Reviews.Author: L0RD_C
Reviews.Content: Somewhere between a warm cosy B&B and a funky party hotel. The SLS comes with Philippe Starck design expertise and chef José Andrés yummy food in the Bazaar restaurant. I had a King-sized room which was very comfortable. The bathroom walls opened up so I could see the TV when shaving! Lots of slate and stainless steel. Very quiet. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and charming. If there were any negatives it would the dimmed lighting in the public areas - you can't wear your sun glasses indoors that's for sure. And the breakfast on offer in the lobby was disappointing... very little choice. I ended up going with the soft egg which was just bland gloop, and the coffee cups are too small. But apart from that the hotel is in a great location, with the Beverly Centre just a block away. There's also a great roof top pool with the usual LA-style cobana's to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robster82
Reviews.Content: Was a bit unsure if we made right decision going by one of the negative reviews of this hotels I read here but was happily reassured we'd made the right choice as the stay was superb to say the least! Right from when we got in the door the staff we polite and friendly. The concierge team were terrific! A special mention must go to both Alex and Cassey who in particular gave us a 1st class service from recommending restaurants, bars and clubs, to booking taxis and car rentals. The hotel itself is well decorated and the room was furnished to a high and modern standard. I like hard mattresses but theirs is medium firm which is why I only give it 4 star. It is situated 5-10 mins walk from Robertson Boulevard where you can find many shops and only 5 mins walk from 3rd where you'll find several good breakfast/lunch restaurants - Toast soon became our favourite - their french toast and berries is in a league of its own! The lively Sunset Blvd and Santa Monica Blvd are only a $6-8 taxi away but if you're anything like us and like to get about the area then a car rental is probably the more economical option as they can soon mount up. FYI our car rental and hotel parking came to just under $400 for the week with their insurance. I'd book in advance and take out your own insurance as it'll reduce the bill significantly - $300 should do it! The Santa Monica and Venice beaches are only about a 15-20 min drive away with Malibu about 30 min but expect a 1-1.5hr journey back if you travel between 3.30 and 6.30... Downtown where you can find Chinatown, Little Tokyo, a great restaurant/patisserie called Louis ... is a 15-20min drive away. Not quite like Manhattan but interesting enough to visit. One word of advice we learned the hard way was the taxi from the airport to hotel. Its a very straight forward route - 2 streets. Go north east on La Tijera and this will take you onto La Cienega where the hotel is situated. It should cost around $35 maybe less. You do not need to go on the freeway which our driver did and it cost $60! If you're renting a car maybe the airport is the best place to pick up from as it pays itself both there and back. Finally, we had a great stay at SLS and have nothing but praise for the whole setup from staff to the room. Location was ideal if you want to stay in a safe convenient area but as LA is spaced out do expect to pay some sort of travel expense unless you are a keen walker!

Reviews.Title: “If you like $70 Bacon and Eggs and $7.00 to print a ticket this is your place”
Reviews.Author: GolfingYogi
Reviews.Content: Constant nickel and diming for a so so room and good service except for luggage and car. Food so so. Nothing unique. Very Noisy at night. Heard everyone that came in late and noisy plumbing. Took forever to get my luggage and car. Not a place if you are going in and out and are busy. Expect to be Charged for every little thing. Most money grubbing hotel ever. If you don't care about value then this is the place for you. Concierge sent us to crappy restaurant. Find your own good restaurant. SPA is small and just has steam but good service. Gym is broken down.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool hotel with gracious service people, but”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Trav
Reviews.Content: the exorbitant service charge at the pool area is ridiculous. C'mon, really?

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: casadei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SLS Beverly Hills October 24-26, 2010to celebrate my best friend’s 50th birthday. It was a great experience overall and we will be returning next year to celebrate my 50th as well. We flew in to Burbank Airport, although the hotel is almost the same distance from LAX. The hotel does not offer shuttle services to the airports although they will arrange car services upon request. Cab fare from Burbank to the SLS will run you about $55 if there isn’t any traffic, so plan accordingly when deciding whether it is more cost effective to hire a car service or take a cab. STAFF The hotel staff and service are incredible. Concierge - I was in email contact with our concierge, Alex Niezgoda, several times prior to our arrival. Alex was able to readily obtain the reservations for even some of the toughest restaurants for us, as well as being a valuable source of information. Once we arrived, we received excellent and professional service from all of the concierge staff. BONUS points for Alex’s expertise and assistance. Bell Captain/Valet – friendly, efficient service every time Front Desk – Also friendly, slightly less efficient, but still exceptional. Minor hitch – we had requested early check in because our flight arrived a bit before noon. Upon arrival, our room wasn’t quite ready. However, the Bell Captain secured our luggage and we went to lunch at Tres while we were waiting. As soon as it was ready, they came and found us in Tres and brought us the keys. Housekeeping – great job! Our room was spotless throughout our stay. Transportation – BONUS points for our driver, Daniel. The SLS has three vehicles available to take guests to any destination within a 3 mile radius of the hotel – an Audi, a Range Rover, and the “jet van”. Bear in mind that the hotel does not provide return service so keep your cell phone handy to call Yellow Cab to pick you up when you are ready to go back to the hotel. I would suggest sticking with Yellow and avoiding United as we had a very bad experience with a United driver “getting lost”. We were lucky enough to have Daniel as our driver throughout our stay, and we can’t say enough about what a wonderful job he does. Daniel is extremely knowledgable about the area in particular and LA in general. He was a significant contributor to making our trip stress free and successful. Wait Staff – TRES – our waiter at Tres was Alexander. Excellent service, cheerfully provided, with solid knowledge of the menu. Kudos to Alexander. BAZAAR – our waiter was the one true DISAPPOINTMENT of the weekend, the only NEGATIVE to our experience. We had a 6:30 reservation on Sunday, the 24th. We sat at a table in the red room right in front of the cotton candy machine. Our waiter was more interested in repeatedly, loudly, berating one of his colleagues who was serving – or trying to serve – a nearby table than he was in answering our questions regarding the menu. Every time we started to ask him a question he would suddenly dart away and begin chastising the other server. It’s a good thing that the rest of the Bazaar serving staff filled in the gap, as our main server was largely absent until the end of the meal. His behavior made all of the guests distinctly uncomfortable. While I certainly intend to eat at Bazaar again next year, I am hoping that I will not be subjected to that server’s unacceptable behavior when we return. His lack of respect and poor performance stood out that much more strongly in comparison to the gracious service we received from everyone else we dealt with at the hotel. THE FACILITIES The Room – We stayed in Room 523, a Premier Double. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the D Porthault sheets are a treat. I love the clean, modern lines of the room and the minimal clutter. At the SLS it is all about the unique details – like the ironing board with the open bird cage on the cover, and the flying bird on the back wall of the closet. The bathroom, with its sliding walls is elegant, yet comfortable. If you are short like I am though, be very careful with the deep soaking tub. It can be tough to climb back out of! I think half the fun of staying at the SLS is wandering through the public areas trying to spot as many of the funky and whimsical elements that are at the core of its design. If Tim Burton has designed a hotel, the SLS would be the result. FOOD Jose Andres and his team – Wow! Don’t bother eating anywhere else while you are there. Stick to Bazaar and Tres. All in all it was everything we hoped for in a celebration weekend. So much so, that I have cancelled the trip I had originally planned for my birthday next year and we will be returning to the SLS instead!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: gidget2
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at SLS in Bev. Hills. The hotel is beautiful- the rooms are modern, sleek and comfortable. The mirrored panels/doors, etc. are a bit much (especially in the bathroom) and it was a bit dark in the room, but other than that - great stay. Hotel employees were very kind and accommodating. It's pricey, but if you have the $$ to spend, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful Hotel :) Hats off to Sam Nazarian, the owner”
Reviews.Author: Baharjoun
Reviews.Content: From the gorgeous Ambiance to the gigantic designer shampoo bottle that can be used for two weeks every day and you will not run out to its very clean, simple yet modern design I need to say it was the most beautiful hotel that I have stayed in. Excellent Location and fantastic service. I recommend it 100 % though pricey but it was WELL worth it. Don't forget Jose Andres' Famous Bazar restaurant located in this hotel and the very interesting night lounge that has to offer for guest to come and hang out :)

Reviews.Title: “For the Hipster only”
Reviews.Author: InglishSanLuisObispo
Reviews.Content: The nicest and most helpful person was probabaly the lowest paid person, the young man that parked our car. Overall the staff seemed to have a very stuffy attitude. The place is to swanky for my taste, the public areas and the rooms were very dark and poorly lit. The tub & shower was hard to figure out how to use, let alone to get in and out of. Could be a hazzard. Front entrance is a smokers paradise. You feel like you are infringing on a private party when you walk up the stairs into the hotel lobby. Concierge was not very helpful. We were not told about the car service offered from the hotel, so we just walked to the Grove (about 1.5 miles) nice walk past many cool stores and restaurants, down 3rd street. When we were ready to leave, we asked a security guard as to where we could get a taxi back to the SLS and they told us about the car serivce. So we called the SLS and asked them to pick us up. They told us that they were busy helping guests get to places and they did not pick up there guests. Never did they offer "can we call a cab for you" or "here is a number for a cab company." They just said sorry, end of call. We were at the hotel for a short stay, but for the money, it just did not have the feel that we were looking for. Not the refind exlegance that one would expect at a Luxury Collection Hotel. The downfall of the hotel is customer service. I had very high expectations coming to a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “stupidly chic”
Reviews.Author: JillWEvergreen_CO
Reviews.Content: The low points: This hotel is gimmicky to the extreme. The very creepy video portraits, which change from Elizabethan men and women into monkeys is the stuff of nightmares. The guest room I shared with my sister was dark and poorly lit. It took us 15 minutes to figure out how to turn on the shower, and we needed to hold onto the wall to get into it, in spite of the fact that she is a triathlete and I'm a runner and cyclist. The sink in the bathroom is large, leaving very little counter space around it. As stated in another review: the outdoor "lobby" is smoke-filled, and the music is way too loud, even at 7am. The breakfast "table", at $24/head, consists of 3 kinds of cold cereal, some cured meats, mini bowls of yogurt and fruit, pastries and fruit. Quite the rip-off. The highlights: The Bazaar was fabulous! Incredible, inventive cuisine. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar menu was the most interesting I've seen. This is a place to party with friends, and see and be seen, but not to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Seems hip. Poor service and impractical.”
Reviews.Author: CrankyHotelGuest
Reviews.Content: Too dark. Restaurant service slow. Rquestsd removal of feather bedding twice due to allergies and was told I was placed in a 'pure' room so I was good to go. Realizing at midnight this wasn't the case, slept the night without a blanket and used one pillow in the room that was foam. Pros: pretty clean and can get Starwood points

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected...only one slight let down”
Reviews.Author: Mike-O-86
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for months now. I'm from the UK and I visited LA for the first time with family. Firstly the hotel definately had the wow factor, very modern, very clean, very hollywood. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated...actually liked the wierd bathroom door that people on here don't like so much. The service was amazing, concierge were so helpful with our first trip to LA. They managed to get us great reservations at restaurants such as XIV (best table in the house btw). Also they drop you off in STYLE! The merc shuttle bus was cool, but they also have cars such as top of the range audis and mercs. Really can't say enough about concierge, trying to remember names...Waldo was cool, Freido knew everything about where to go and Laurie(?) was sooo resourceful. Warner Bros left the tag on my souvenier t-shirt and Laurie manged to get it sorted for me - t-shirt back at my door within 30mins!! I really hope i got the names correct as they are doing their jobs WELL! There was one guy however that often worked at the same time as Laurie who was unneccassarily rude ALL the time... wish I could remember his name LOL. If it wasn't for him, I would've rated service as 5. Pool = v cool, just wish it didn't close at 9. Expect to see celebs! lol I'm back in LA in Feb, want to stay here but it's full :( Maybe I'll still checkout the Bazaar ?

Reviews.Title: “depressing would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelalot025
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks hip & cool but the rooms are V ordinary - although the furnishings are quite nice it feels really dark and boxed in, actually quite depressing!! I'm in a studio suite and it's like being in a dark little hole, no view whatsoever, no bath and stinks of cigarettes! I'm booked here for 10 days - no way I can stay here AWFUL!!!! I travel 6 months of the year and are fortunate to be able to stay in V nice hotels - sadly this not one I could recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service, average dining, a few quirks.”
Reviews.Author: venicerenee
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum SPG member, a luxury weekend away is a rare and wonderful experience. We stayed at the SLS for a fun night away and hoped for an equally indulgent dinner experience. The hotel was nice, but the Premier Rooms were a bit small. Service was very good, but had a quirky problem with the wrong name associated with our room...called front desk 3 x's to have it changed, but they never fixed it. Had drinks & Tapas in the renowned Bazaar restaurant/bar. Service was terrible - watched our drinks sit on the bar ready for pickup, for 10 minutes. Staff was gossiping about clientele and tapas were salty and over priced for the quality. We went to Morton's next door to eat - which was wonderful and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary luxury with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisquigley
Reviews.Content: At last, a hotel that cares how it looks beyond the public areas. Carpets you sink into, rooms that make you feel you are on holiday and attention to detail that most hotels would wish for. Alex at concierge was excellent. Our first time in LA, he made sure we made the most of our visit. Lionel and Dan in the house car gave us all the information we needed as they took us around in luxury. The rooftop pool, Altitude was chic and relaxed, with excellent service from the staff. If you like contemporary luxury, cool design and being well looked after, visit the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “If you liked Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland you'll love this place--I didn't.”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the SLS got mixed reviews. The teenagers thought it was cool; my husband found it stylish and innovative. I thought it was too weird to really feel comfortable. The whole Phillippe Stark style made me feel like I was at MoMA (or maybe a less celebrated Modern art museum)--the pool, especially, surrounded by frames and mirrors was just too weird for me. It was basically like Tim Burton's vision of Alice in Wonderland--if you liked that, you'll love this hotel. The furniture was all meant to be impressive but not particularly functional, For example, there were not outlets near the bed, and the side tables, while chic, didn't have full shelves so things kept slipping down onto the floor. The shower doors did not close well so things kept dropping to the floor when the door was "slammed." One had to walk behind the bed to get places, and trip on wires (ah--there were the outlets!!) Service was good--the valet staff was very friendly and prompt and the registration desk was staffed by energetic people. They raved about the fitness center which turned out to be just okay. I didn't need the concierge at all, which is probably just as well--I'm sure they could have directed me to clubs, etc., which I am way too old for. Bottom line: not the right scene for a suburban mom.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated glamour, outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: smcp
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the SLS for 5 nights. It is a great location in Beverly Hills and easily accessible. The Hotel is similar in style to a Schrager hotel - oversized pieces in the reception area, digital art, mood lighting and sound. So from the get go I would say that unless you place some value on innovative design and modern interpretations it is not going to be for you and that you would be better off with a more traditional luxury hotel. I am Platinum with Starwood, booked a standard room and got a Terrace Room which has a decent outside space - a nice option. So check in desk was exceptionally helpful, in fact the experience with all the staff has been positive from the lobby to the two restaurants to the valets. The rooms value design over function - expensive custom furniture and lighting, an oversized shower (no bath) - but very little space for clothing and storage. There are opulent touches such as the hand blown glass lighting, smoked mirror that hides a TV and custom Stark furniture. Beds are very comfortable. Couple of comments: the oversized toiletry bottles are not for take away and I personally like the large bottles as opposed to fiddling with tiny things to squeeze out little globs. However, although the texture of the products are very nice the SLS have missed a trick by not having a signature scent for any of the products - they are simply bland. The towels too are not bath sheets and feel rather cheap to me for a hotel of this standard. The bath robes though are large and luxurious - the kind you want to lounge in all day. Food for breakfast is expensive other then the buffet which again is innovative and a nice follow through from the superlative Bazaaar which is a must try - incredible food. The pool area can be a little intimidating - clearly pitched to the beautiful people of LA but again I found no problem with the attitude of the staff there. Valet was efficient - you pay the one charge for the entire day, in and out as many times as you want. Overall I was very pleased with my stay and would recommend the experience to couples or singles looking for an innovative, sophisticated stay with lots to admire.

Reviews.Title: “Complete lack of Coordination”
Reviews.Author: rachilde
Reviews.Content: From the starstruck people at reception oozing, "It's Emmy Week!" as an excuse for everything to the attitude laden rooftop pool, (it says Altitude on the door, but that is clearly a misspelling), this place lacks the coordination and grace of truly great local hotels in the area such as the Chateau Marmont and the Sunset Marquis. This place plays at being a Hollywood in spot but fails at every turn, which is a pity, because the Bazaar Restaurant is a great place to dine. It was on the strength of the restaurant that I recommended the hotel to my sister to stay in - a recommendation I now very much regret. Guests are charged each time there car goes in and out of the hotel, so I attempted to get a taxi to get home instead of having my sister incur charges. The parking staff was so unorganized that they gave taxi to someone just leaving the adjacent lobby dining area. Then they asked if I was going to Rodeo Drive. No, thanks. I am not a tourist, but a local who has no need to go there. Someone ordered the hotel car but it was never entirely clear if it was meant for me or not because the parking staff were not communicating with each other. After waiting interminably I just walked home, as itw as less than two miles. When friends from out of town ask where to stay I will NEVER EVER recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: sezy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hip hotel for a night or two in Beverley Hills this is really funky and is in a good location to see all the sights. Has a small rooftop pool which gets very busy but ideal for a dip.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is Amazing in almost every way! I would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: ATLflyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fine hotels throughout the world including Peninsula's and many Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons properties and am a Platinum SPG member. Upon arrival my co worker and I were met by some of the friendliest and best hotel staff I have encountered in a long time. The bellman was extremely professional and even showed my co woreker how to use everything in her room and let her know where she could find me down the hall. The hotel does all the little things right from having complimentary almonds and lemonaide in the afternoon to having a seperate cabana set up for platinum guests at the pool. Everyone at the ffront desk and concierge desks are available to help and are always eager and happy to be helpful. The Mercedes and Audi towncars are a great addition and Lionel and Frank are great and helpful. My co worker and I would both return the next time we are in LA. I will say there was one thing that was strange but I never did have my room turned down even though I had requested it. All in all though a very minor complaint and this is a GREAT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: RLevy1
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you'll like this hotel depends on what you're looking for. The SLS is incredibly beautiful. It is probably one of the most aesthetically pleasing hotels I've ever stayed in. In fact, the lobby is outside the hotel. With all that said, it is not the warmest hotel. The place is designed to be the new LA hot spot, not a home away from home. A friend of mine came to visit me at the hotel and had to pay for valet because there is hardly any street parking. The valet is not cheap, so it was unfortunate that there were no other real options. There is also an extra charge for pretty much anything in the room itself (internet, certain toiletries, and even dice that they put there as decoration). So, if you're looking for a modern, unique, hip place then the SLS is perfect for you. If you're looking for a place where you'll feel comfortable and at home, then you might want to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: dbeals
Reviews.Content: Used SPG points + cash for a $185 room rate. We were upgraded to a suite. Room modern and beautiful. Service superb! Who cares (see previous reviews) that there are large bottles of shampoo and soap. Much more environmentally conscious than small disposable bottles

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...but very cliche LA and not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt the SLS Beverly Hills is a beautiful 5-star property. The rooms are spacious and luxurious, with gorgeous beds complete with glass headboards and televisions built into the wall. Like other reviewers have pointed out, though, the ambience of the hotel is VERY dark. Mood lighting throughout, including in the lobby, guest rooms, bathrooms etc. Staff were pleasant and very friendly, although you never escape the LA fakeness in the way they serve you. The pool is a challenge to hang out at, especially on Sundays when they have their weekly pool party. I went up before 11am and waited about an hour before I was able to get lounge chairs. The restaurant, Bazaar, is great though! Wonderful Spanish style tapas that cannot be missed! And if you can look past the $18 price tag on the gin and tonic, it's really worth ordering! It is as unique a gin and tonic as you can ever find!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! I'll definitely be back :)”
Reviews.Author: moncrawford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS hotel for the first time this past weekend, and absolutely loved it! I lived in Los Angeles about 20 years ago, and this was my first time back in about 13 years. While I don't think the scene will appeal to everyone, it was perfect for me. The most enjoyable part of my stay was the spa experience, I love, love, loved the decor and my body treatments were superb. I highly recommend Julia. I added a bath to my services which was heavenly, and will definitely return to experience the couples package in the very cool spa bath suite. I enjoyed the brunch and the bar had a very upbeat and vibrant atmosphere. Poolside was relaxing. I appreciated the privacy options at the dining areas and poolside. Can't beat the location in terms of access to shopping, dining, nightlife. Overall, very sexy hotel. I don't think the older Peninsula Hotel-type crowd would enjoy it, but would definitely suit the hip and upbeat of any age.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE AT A 5 STAR LEVEL”
Reviews.Author: SeaCaroline
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every singe unique touch to this hotel. The rooftop pool and bar are a must. The rooms were incredible.....nothing like we had ever seen before. Both Restaurants, Bizarre and Tres were outstanding. If you are looking for a place that will take you into the future of the hotel industry. This hotel is a must. We dined at the famous restuarant Bizarre, and we were very impressed. This is a boutique hotel, and everthing from style to design will take you into the future of how we define space and community. Excellent and refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum SPG member. We stayed at SLS because of Bazaar and the reputation of Jose Andres. To me the hotel is kind of a juiced up W where the guest better be willing to part with a LOT of cash. When I checked in I was told I was upgraded to a Studio Suite and that room is the only room they upgrade Platinum members. I would love to see a standard room, because our room would not be described by many people as a suite. Was it somewhat larger than a typical hotel room....maybe? I guess it would depend on who you were talking to. So we got upgraded to a larger room and the decor is very typical of a W. I thought the amenities were tacky. They provide oversized plastic bottles of shampoo, body wash, conditioner, which I am positive that if a guest took one they would get charged. For those of you who enjoy taking nice amenities when you leave, there's NO reason to take them. When I'm dropping well in excess of $300/night on a hotel room I want to see L'Occitane or Bulgari or something name brand plastered on the amenities. I don't want to see generic "made for the SLS" shampoo. Furthermore, do I want to handle the soap bottle after the last guest who used the toilet or had God knows what else on his hands? This was a bigger issue for me. Yeah, it's a funky quirky vibe the designers are going for with the reusable soaps/conditioner, and I'm sure it's green because they aren't wasting as much plastic, but I'm about not handling things other people have handled. As per other guests critiques, there isn't a bathtub, probably because there isn't room for it, even though we were supposedly upgraded to a suite! HA. Closet space is fine, but the ironing board is a strange little thing meant to sit on the table top. I've never seen anything like it. CHEAP would be the word that comes to mind. It wasn't trendy or minimalist, so all I can think is they needed to save money. The rooms are HIP, modern and minimalist. If you're not comfortable walking through a Design Within Reach store then this isn't the place for you to stay. A friend suggested it's more along the lines of Roche Bobois, but I can guarantee the furnishings don't come anywhere near the price point of Roche. Lighting is dim, which wasn't a problem for us, but others might not enjoy the look. I actually thought the room was quite pleasant and the bed quite comfortable, but CLEARLY not worth the final bill. So, other details. The Sunday brunch was $38/person and $48 with a cava Mimosa. We thought it was too much like a continental breakfast. Little pastries, chocolate, yogurt, fruit cups. There was caviar (we don't eat caviar) and there was Lox and also some roast beef being carved....otherwise it felt like continental breakfast on steroids. We opted for the choice without the cava Mimosa. Price for two with tax and tip $96. Not exactly a bargain. Parking $35. Depending on your arrival and departure from the hotel I would suggest parking on the street around the hotel and using meters. With a little ingenuity you can bypass the fee. On Sunday we sat poolside (it's a small pool) on the 6th floor and enjoyed watching the 20 somethings that the hotel personnel kept escorting up to the pool area. The signs are explicit that hotel guests only are at the pool, but we noticed that the younger set would be escorted from the lobby by the help and allowed into the pool area, which was packed and had a variety of guests waiting for cabanas and chairs. There is a DJ on Sundays and the music is thumping. This is the same company that owns the Abbey nightclub in West Hollywood and I think they are trying to cultivate an atmostphere at the pool and fill it with young Hollywood wannabees who think it's glamorous to have entree into a swank hotel's pool area for a Sunday DJ party. We had two drinks, thank God. The mojito is just $16 and a Campari $13. With automatic 20% gratuity added and the tax we went back to our room with a $38 bill....for two drinks!!! The Sangria is $50 a pitcher, so imagine with food what kind of bill some guests run up during the day. One of my friends who parties constantly around Beverly Hills suggested that SLS attracts a lot of younger wealthy persian/middle eastern 20 somethings. I thought that was an odd comment, until we got to the pool on Sunday. Same with Bazaar, the later it got the more it felt like a Persian nightclub. And the best part for the hotel is they appeared to be spending, spending, spending. Dinner at Bazaar was wonderful. $55 prix fixe is the way to go. They have several tapas and unless you just want one or two items, it will be far cheaper to order the set tasting menu. Also, we chose to drink tap water over the sparkling or still they try to sell. Most are only $10 a bottle and yes they have quite a selection. Some of the beer is reasonably priced as is iced tea and sodas. Hot tea $8. Here the cocktails are as high as $20 each and the wines can become stratospheric.
